definitions.definition: the bony body part found on either side of the upper body that extends from the base of the neck, the base of the arms, and upper torso
the fine, gray, powdery remains of something that had been burned

examples.text: Nag guwa sa baba kang bulkan ang abo.
examples.translation: Volcanic ash came out of the crater

examples.text: Nag-abo ang tawo tapos masunog.
examples.translation: A man turned into ash after being burnt.

examples.text: Naga-abo man ang tawo kung masunog?
examples.translation: Do humans turn into ash if they are burnt?

examples.text: Ma-abo ang tawo kung masunog.
examples.translation: A human will turn into ash if burnt.

definitions.definition: to arrive at a given location near or related to the speaker/s

examples.text: Nag-abot tana nga wara ako kamaan.
examples.translation: She came without my knowledge.

examples.text: Nagaabot run ang mga bisita.
examples.translation: The visitors are coming.

examples.text: Naga-abot-abot sakit ka busong ko.
examples.translation: My stomachache comes and goes.

examples.text: Maabot run kuno ang mga supply.
examples.translation: It is said that the supplies will come.

examples.text: Manog-abot ang regla ko.
examples.translation: My menstruation is coming.

definitions.definition: to act like crazy or to lose control oneself

examples.text: Gin-abot kang pagka-abnormal si Norma kagab-e.
examples.translation: Norma acted like an abnormal person last night.

examples.text: Gina-abot  nanaman si Norma.
examples.translation: Norma is acting crazy again.

examples.text: Nugay niyo ka sunlog si Norma, abuton ra gani kar-on ka pagka-abno na, masakit na kamo.
examples.translation: Stop bullying Norma. If she loses control of herself, she will hurt you.

examples.text: Inabot naman ang utod mo.
examples.translation: Your sibling is acting weird again.

examples.text: Nugay ka sunlog ang bata ko. Arabutun ra nga daan.
examples.translation: Do not tease my son. He becomes crazy at times.

definitions.definition: the ball of bright light that moves high across the sky that gives light and heat during the day;

examples.text: Nagabutlak ang adlaw.
examples.translation: The sun is shining.

definitions.definition: the anniversary of the day which a person is born

examples.text: Isaulog natun ang imo kaadlawan.
examples.translation: Let's celebrate your birthday.

examples.text: Adlawon run nagbugtaw si Rizza.
examples.translation: Rizza woke up late in the morning.

definitions.definition: occuring every day

examples.text: Naga-obra tana adlaw-adlaw.
examples.translation: She is working everyday.

examples.text: Mayad nga aga.
examples.translation: Good morning.

definitions.definition: occuring every morning

examples.text: Aga-aga ran nagasinggit dayon magkadlaw.
examples.translation: Every morning, she shouts and then laughs.

examples.text: Aga-aga tana ya para magsugal.
examples.translation: This is  very early to gamble.

definitions.definition: the last and youngest child born to a family

examples.text: Amo diya agot mo? Kagwapo.
examples.translation: Is this your youngest child? He is handsome.

definitions.definition: to move with purpose to another given place or direction

examples.text: Agto dya.
examples.translation: Come here.

examples.text: Nag-agto tana sa andang daan nga banwa.
examples.translation: She went to her old town.

examples.text: Maagto tana sa inyo lugar.
examples.translation: She will go to your place.

examples.text: Nagapaagto tana sa simbahan.
examples.translation: She is now on her way to the church.

examples.text: Paagtunon mo si nanay mo sa eskwelahan.
examples.translation: Tell you mother to go to the school.

examples.text: Gapamangkot kaw kung sa diin ako maagto? Sekret! Basta sa aragtunan ko nga indi mo man-an.
examples.translation: You are asking me where I am going? It is a secret. It's a place somewhere you don't know.

definitions.definition: the singular pronoun used to refer to the speaker in first person;

examples.text: Ako  si Mercy.
examples.translation: I am Mercy.

definitions.definition: a small insect that has a small slender body and has flat, larger, and more colorful wings;

examples.text: Swertehun kita ka diya kay may nagsulod nga alibangbang sa balay.
examples.translation: We will get lucky because a butterfly entered our house.

definitions.definition: the part of the upper body that is found at the end of each arm that each has fingers, wrists, and a thumb

examples.text: Dapat hugasan natun ang atun alima bago magkaon.
examples.translation: We must wash our hands before we eat.

examples.text: Nagaalima tana sa pagkaun.
examples.translation: He is using his bare hands in eating.

examples.text: Ginaalima na ang pagkaun.
examples.translation: She is using her hands in eating the food.

examples.text: Nag-alima takun.
examples.translation: I used my hands.

examples.text: Gin-alima ko ang pagkaun kang pinakas.
examples.translation: I used my hands in eating dried fish.

examples.text: Maalima lang ko sa panyapon.
examples.translation: I will just use my hands in dinner.

examples.text: Alimahon ko lang akun nga pagkaun.
examples.translation: I will use my hands to eat my food.

definitions.definition: a bunch of hair that grows and sticks in a different direction than the rest of the hair on the head

examples.text: Darwa guid ang akun nga alimpuros sa ulo.
examples.translation: I have two cowlick in my head.

definitions.definition: the wind that blows from the north and east that brings cool, dry, and cloudless weather

examples.text: Amihan run, wara run ti uran.
examples.translation: It is now season of northwest moonsoon, there will be no more rain.

definitions.definition: to be infested by termites

examples.text: Gina-anay ang daan ta nga balay.
examples.translation: Our old house is being eaten by termites.

examples.text: Gin-anay ang daan ta nga balay.
examples.translation: Our old house was eaten by termites.

examples.text: Istari ang daan nga balay para hindi pag-anayun.
examples.translation: You stay in our old house so that it will not be eaten by termites.

definitions.definition: a word used to ask and to know more about a given topic

examples.text: Ano gin-obra mo?
examples.translation: What did you do?

examples.text: Naga-ano ikaw diya?
examples.translation: What are you doing here?

definitions.definition: to submit and accept suffering

examples.text: Antos kaw lang anay 'nak sa gutum kay wara kita kwarta barakal kang pagkaun.
examples.translation: Son, endure your hunger because we do not have money to buy food.

examples.text: Nag-antos si Kristo sa kasakit para maluwas sa mga sala ang kalibutan.
examples.translation: Christ suffered to save mankind from sins.

examples.text: Gin-antos ko ang kabudlay mag-obra sagwa Pilipinas para buhiun ko mga bata ko.
examples.translation: I endured the difficulty of working abroad to support my children.

examples.text: Gina-antos ko ang sakit kang ulo ko para lang makakita kwarta kag makakaon kita.
examples.translation: I am enduring my headache just to earn money to buy food.

examples.text: Naga-antos ako sa sakit kang busong ko.
examples.translation: I am enduring my stomach ache.

examples.text: Ma-antos kaw guid kar-on kang kasakit kang pilas mo kung indi mo ra pabulungon.
examples.translation: You will suffer the pain from your wound if you will not treat it.

examples.text: Antosa lang ang sakit kang gin-bayaan na ikaw. Malipas lang ra.
examples.translation: Endure the pain of breaking up. It will pass.

definitions.definition: the number that comes after five and comes before seven;

examples.text: Paborito ko nga numero ang anum.
examples.translation: My favorite number is six.

examples.text: Anum kabilog ang akun ayam.
examples.translation: I have six dogs.

definitions.definition: being unable to speak or having no voice

examples.text: Apa run ra tana halin pag bata kana.
examples.translation: She/He is mute since she/he was born.

definitions.definition: the number that comes after three and comes before five;

examples.text: Apat ang nagasunod sa tatlo.
examples.translation: Four comes after three.

examples.text: Nagbiyahe kami sa bilog nga apat ka oras.
examples.translation: We travelled for almost four hours.

definitions.definition: a bitter liquid produced by the liver, stored in the gallbladder, and used in the small intestines to help in digestion

examples.text: Ginbuul ang ana apdo.
examples.translation: Her bile was removed.

definitions.definition: the legal female partner in a marriage;

examples.text: Asawa na ang nagdaog sa rampa-rampa ka gab-e.
examples.translation: It was his wife who won the pageant last night.

examples.text: Mangasawa run takun.
examples.translation: I am getting married.

examples.text: Nangasawa run ang akun tiyo.
examples.translation: My uncle got married.

definitions.definition: the white substance used in cooking to give food more flavour and to preserve certain types of food

examples.text: Diin mo ginbutang ang asin?
examples.translation: Where did you put the salt?

examples.text: Andut gina-asinan mo ria?
examples.translation: Why are seasoning it with salt?

examples.text: Gin-asinan ko run ang isda.
examples.translation: I already seasoned the fish with salt.

examples.text: Asini ria.
examples.translation: Season it with salt.

examples.text: Asinan mo dapat ang dapli.
examples.translation: You need to season the dish with salt.

definitions.definition: having a sharp, acidic taste or smell

examples.text: Aslum ang mangga.
examples.translation: The mango is sour.

examples.text: Aslum-aslum gid ang langgaw halin sa bukid.
examples.translation: The vinegar from the mountain is very sour.

definitions.definition: a visible stream of vapor and gases that float out of a fire or burning object

examples.text: Lantawa ang aso.
examples.translation: look at the smoke.

examples.text: Naga-aso run ang rice-cooker.
examples.translation: The rice-cooker is smoking.

examples.text: Ano oras nag-aso ang bulkan?
examples.translation: What time did the volcano start to smoke?

examples.text: Bantayan mo mag-aso ang uring ha.
examples.translation: You check if the coal has started to smoke.

definitions.definition: the large internal organ found on the upper-right side of the abdomen that produces bile, processes blood, and helps dispose of wastes from the body

examples.text: Tama run ka rangga ang akun nga atay.
examples.translation: My liver is heavily damaged.

definitions.definition: the part of a building that covers it on top, and protects the insides from the sun and weather

examples.text: Gin-palid kang bagyo ang atup namun.
examples.translation: The typhoon washed away our roof.

examples.text: Kamo nang-atup sa bag-o nga balay ni Mercy?
examples.translation: Did your group put up the roof of the new house of Mercy?

examples.text: Tulad nga adlaw, mang-atup ang mga panday sa bag-o nga balay ni Mercy.
examples.translation: Today, the workers will put up the roof on the new house of Mercy.

examples.text: Atupi niyo nga daan ang balay antis pa mag tag-ururan.
examples.translation: You put up the roof our house while it is not yet wet season.

examples.text: Atupan pa nanda ang bag-o nga balay.
examples.translation: They are yet to put up the roof of the new house.

examples.text: Nagapang-atup tulad ang mga panday ni Mercy sa bag-o na nga balay.
examples.translation: The workers are now putting up

examples.text: Gin-atupan run nanda ang bag-o nga balay.
examples.translation: They already put up the roof of the new house.

examples.text: Gina-atupan pa lang kang mga panday ang bag-o nga balay ni Mercy.
examples.translation: The laborers are still putting up the roof of the new house of Mercy.

examples.text: Wara pa matapos balay ni Miriam. Aratupan pa.
examples.translation: Miriam's house is unfinished. They are yet to put up the roof.

definitions.definition: the waxy substance found in the outer ear canal

examples.text: Dulaw ang kolor kang akun atutuli.
examples.translation: The color of my earwax is yellow.

definitions.definition: the act of having at least two people becoming hostile, and engaging in physical or armed combat with each other;

examples.text: Sin-o nga boksidor may away tulad?
examples.translation: Whose boxer has a fight today?

examples.text: Ang pagkatikalun mo arawayun guid ninyo nga magbugto.
examples.translation: Your boastfulness will cause a fight between you and your siblings.

examples.text: Nugay ka away ang magurang mo.
examples.translation: Do not pick a fight with your elder sibling.

examples.text: Gin-away ni manong ang nag sakit kanakun.
examples.translation: My elder brother picked a fight with the person that hurt me.

examples.text: Gin-awayan namun ni manang ang parte sa lupa nga ginbilin ni nanay.
examples.translation: My sister and I fought over the land left to us by our mother.

examples.text: Gin-sakit kaw nanda? Awayun ta sanda.
examples.translation: Did they hurt you? Let us pick a fight with them.

examples.text: Indi pag-awaya si Jun.
examples.translation: Do not pick a fight with Jun.

examples.text: Gapang-away si Tisay sa libayon na.
examples.translation: Tisay is picking a fight with her younger sister.

examples.text: Gairinaway liwat ang magbugto parte sa lupa nga ginbilin ni nanay nanda.
examples.translation: The siblings are again fighting over the land that was left to them by their mother.

definitions.definition: the act of having at least two people having an angry spoken disagreement with each other, but not engaging in physical or armed combat

examples.text: Wara ti katapusan ang away kang magburugto.
examples.translation: The quarrel of siblings is never-ending.

examples.text: Indi bala magpangaway kanakun.
examples.translation: Do not quarrel with me.

definitions.definition: an injury or wound improves or is back to its normal condition

examples.text: Ayad run si tatay.
examples.translation: My father is healed.

examples.text: Nag-ayad run ang pilas ko,
examples.translation: My wound healed.

examples.text: Nagaayad ang pilas ko.
examples.translation: My wound is healing.

examples.text: Maayad ikaw, pangamuyo lang guid.
examples.translation: You will be healed, just keep on praying.

examples.text: Dok, paayada ang bata ko.
examples.translation: Doc, please heal my child.

definitions.definition: a common, small- to medium-sized, meat-eating animal covered in fur, and has claws, fangs, and a tail;

examples.text: Pira ka bilog ang ayam mo?
examples.translation: How many dogs do you have?

definitions.definition: person, animal to search, chase, and catch something for its meat or for sport

examples.text: Nagapang-ayam sanda kang mga ilahas.
examples.translation: They hunt wild animals.

examples.text: Ginapang-ayam ni Ricky ang mga nagpalagyo nga spat.
examples.translation: Ricky is hunting the animals that escaped.

examples.text: Nagpang-ayam sanda kang sapat para sa pagkaun.
examples.translation: They hunted animals for foods.

examples.text: Ginpang-ayam ni Thea ang nabilin sa talon.
examples.translation: Thea had hunted what remained in the jungle.

examples.text: Mang-ayam kita kang mga ilahas sa talon.
examples.translation: Let us hunt wild animals in the forest.

examples.text: Ayamun natun ang nagapanghalit nga sawa.
examples.translation: We will hunt the destructive snake.

examples.text: Hangkilan nga mangangayam si Tomas.
examples.translation: Tomas is a skilled hunter.

definitions.definition: the part of the face that includes the lips, mouth, and lower jaw

examples.text: Tabunan ang baba kon mag-ubo.
examples.translation: Cover your mouth when you cough.

examples.text: Babaan gid ang libayun ni Tibo.
examples.translation: Tibo's younger sibling is very talkative.

definitions.definition: the opening on the face that is used to take in food, drink, and air

examples.text: Hipusa baba mo!
examples.translation: Shut up your mouth!

definitions.definition: a polite expression of good wishes or excusing yourself from other people before leaving a conversation or meeting

examples.text: Babay mama.
examples.translation: Goodbye, mom.

examples.text: Babay run to sa mga mal-am kay mauli run ta.
examples.translation: You say goodbye to the elders because we will go home now.

examples.text: Nag-babay run ako.
examples.translation: I already bid goodbye.

examples.text: Hulat lang bala. Naga-babay pa ako sa ginikanan ko.
examples.translation: Wait. I am still saying goodbye to my parents.

examples.text: Ma-babay ako anay kay nanay.
examples.translation: I will just say goobye to my mother.

definitions.definition: an omnivorous domesticated hoofed mammal with sparse bristly hair and a flat snout for rooting in the soil, kept for its meat.

examples.text: Pira ka bilog baboy mo?
examples.translation: How many pigs do you have?

definitions.definition: one of the two internal organs found on either side of the chest and protected by the ribs, and where air is stored when breathing in, and turns oxygen into carbon dioxide when breathing out

examples.text: Ang sigarilyo makaguba kang imo nga baga.
examples.translation: Cigarretes can damage your lungs.

definitions.definition: a small piece of coal or wood that has been burnt but is still burning hot even after the fire has died out

examples.text: Ang baga makaumpisa kang sunog.
examples.translation: Ember can start up a fire.

definitions.definition: to apply friction and pressure to a surface

examples.text: Si Pepito nagabag-id kang tsinela sa salug.
examples.translation: Pepito is rubbing his slippers against the floor.

examples.text: Ginabag-id kang kuti ang lawas na sa akun kahig.
examples.translation: The cat rubs itself against my feet.

examples.text: Nagbag-id ako kang darwa ka tsinelas.
examples.translation: I rubbed the two slippers against each other.

examples.text: Ginbag-id na ang anang likod sa pader.
examples.translation: He rubbed his back against the wall.

examples.text: Mabag-id kita kang binangon sa semento para pangontra sa aswang.
examples.translation: We will rub the bolo against the floor to counter the witch.

examples.text: I-bag-id ang metal sa bato.
examples.translation: Rub the metal on the stone.

definitions.definition: a medium or large, meat-eating fish with a long body, rough skin, large fin, and sharp teeth;

examples.text: Takas kamo kay may bagis.
examples.translation: Get out of the water because there is a shark.

examples.text: Manamit ang ginat-an.
examples.translation: Manamit ang ginat-an.

examples.text: Butangi gata ang chicken curry.
examples.translation: Add the coconut milk in chicken curry.

definitions.definition: an object being recently made, used, or discovered

examples.text: Ginbuksan nanda ang bag-o nga museo.
examples.translation: They open the new museum.

examples.text: Ginbag-o ni Sir ang desisyon na.
examples.translation: Sir changed his decision.

examples.text: Daw indi ta run ikaw kilala. Nag-bag-o ka run guid.
examples.translation: I don't know you anymore. You have changed a lot.

examples.text: Naga-bag-o ang tawo kung naga manggaranun.
examples.translation: People change when they become wealthy.

examples.text: Magbag-o ko laptop.
examples.translation: I will change my laptop.

examples.text: Mabag-o guid kang kwarta ang tawo.
examples.translation: Money can change people.

examples.text: Bag-oha batasan mo.
examples.translation: Change your attitude.

examples.text: Hambal ni mama, bag-ohun ko kuno batasan ko.
examples.translation: My mom said that I change my attitude.

examples.text: Ginapabag-o kanatun ni Sir ang disenyo ka balay na.
examples.translation: Sir would like us to change the design of his house.

definitions.definition: the bone structure that frames the head, supports the face, and protects the brain

examples.text: Nabuka ang ana nga bagul.
examples.translation: His skull got fractured.

examples.text: Bagulan nga klase bata si Benly.
examples.translation: Benly is a hard headed person.

definitions.definition: a large amount of rising water that overflows and covers once dry land

examples.text: Ginuba kang baha ang balay ni Jam.
examples.translation: Jam's house was damaged by the flood.

examples.text: Nagabaha sa anda lugar.
examples.translation: It is flooding in their place.

examples.text: Ginabaha ang parayan ni Juan.
examples.translation: Juan's ricefield is being flooded.

examples.text: Nagbaha sa amon kang nagbagyo.
examples.translation: Our place was flooded when it stormed.

examples.text: Ginbaha ang amon lugar.
examples.translation: Our place was flooded.

examples.text: Pamatyag ko, mabaha gid ang suba.
examples.translation: I feel that the river will get flooded.

examples.text: Indi magpang-utod it mga kahoy hay basi bahaun ang inyong lugar.
examples.translation: Don't cut trees, your place might get flooded.

examples.text: Barahaun ang lugar nga ria.
examples.translation: That are is flood-prone.

definitions.definition: an adult female human

examples.text: Ikaw ang pinaka-gwapa nga bahi nga nakita ko.
examples.translation: You are the most beautiful woman that I've ever seen

definitions.definition: having a strong, bad, and rotten smell

examples.text: Baho ana nga angsud.
examples.translation: Her body odor smell so bad.

examples.text: Baho-baho iruk mo.
examples.translation: Your armpit smells very bad.

examples.text: Nagbaho ang patay nga kuti.
examples.translation: The dead cat smelled bad.

examples.text: Nagbaraho ang mga patay nga kuti.
examples.translation: The dead cats were emitting bad smell.

examples.text: Nagabaho ang tawo kung wara garigos.
examples.translation: The odor of the person smells bad if he/she does not take a bath.

examples.text: Mabaho ang karne kung indi masulod sa freezer.
examples.translation: The meat will smell bad if not put inside the freezer.

definitions.definition: having a greater size than normal

examples.text: Bahul ang balay ni Denmark.
examples.translation: Denmark's house is big.

examples.text: Bahul-bahul kahig ni Renz.
examples.translation: Renz feet are very big.

examples.text: Hanggud ang balud sa baybay.
examples.translation: The waves in the sea are big.

examples.text: Hanggud-hanggud ang lawas ni Romeo.
examples.translation: Romeo's body is very big

examples.text: Nagbahul run si Tony.
examples.translation: Tony grew bigger.

examples.text: Nagabahul ang punggud mo sa dahi.
examples.translation: Your pimple on your forehead is growing bigger.

examples.text: Mabahul ikaw kung gaturog ikaw walo ka oras sa kada adlaw.
examples.translation: You will grow bigger if you sleep eight hours a day.

examples.text: Nag-hanggud ang pilas mo sa alima.
examples.translation: The wound in your hand grew bigger.

examples.text: Naga-hanggud ang pilas mo sa alima.
examples.translation: The wound in your hand is growing bigger.

examples.text: Ma-hanggud ra ang pilas mo sa alima kung indi mo pag-bulungon.
examples.translation: That wound in your hand will grow bigger if you deny treatment.

examples.text: Ginpabahul ko anay ang tanum antis ko ginbaligya sa mahal nga presyo.
examples.translation: I grew my plant bigger before I sold it at a high price.

examples.text: Indi ko pa pagbaligya ang tanum ko. Ginapabahul ko pa para mapresyohan.
examples.translation: I am not selling my plant. I am growing it bigger so I can sell it at a high price.

examples.text: Bahul guid ang gin-hanggud kang tanum.
examples.translation: The plant grew big.

examples.text: Hulat lang. Ginapahanggud ko pa ang ayam antis ibaligya.
examples.translation: Wait. I am still growing my dog to become big before I sell it.

examples.text: Indi anay pagbaligya ra ang tanum, pabahulun ko pa ra para mas mahal ibaligya.
examples.translation: do not sell that plant. I will grow it bigger so I can sell it at a higher price.

examples.text: Tao ko kanimo diya nga tanum. Ipahanggudun mo ha.
examples.translation: I will give this plant to you. You will have to grow it big.

definitions.definition: the act of suddenly forcing air out through one's nose and mouth because of itching in the nostrils

examples.text: Ang bahun ni nanay pirti ka tunog.
examples.translation: My mother's sneeze is very loud.

examples.text: Nag-bahun si nanay ti tudo.
examples.translation: My mother sneezed very loud.

examples.text: Naga-bahun si nanay.
examples.translation: My mother is sneezing.

examples.text: Sigurado guid nga ma-bahun guid ako kang ka baho mo.
examples.translation: Your bad odor will surely make me sneeze.

examples.text: Nanghatsi ako kaina sa patay.
examples.translation: Earlier, I sneezed in a wake.

examples.text: Kung mag-agto kaw sa patay, indi kaw manghatsi kay kadu ra hambal kang mga mal-am.
examples.translation: When you go to a wake, do not sneeze because it is bad according to the elders.

examples.text: Kaina pa ako ka aga nagahatsi. Katul irong ko.
examples.translation: I have been sneezing since morning. My nose is itchy.

examples.text: Daw mahatsi ako sa kabaho kang banyo.
examples.translation: I feel like I will sneeze due to the foul odor in the toilet room.

examples.text: Nanay, nagapanghatsi si Santi kanakun.
examples.translation: Mom, Santi has been sneezing on me.

definitions.definition: to get and own something in exchange with fair payment or by barter

examples.text: Nagabakal si Nelvin kang pagkaun.
examples.translation: Nelvin is buying food.

examples.text: Ginabakal ni Jonas ang lupa.
examples.translation: Jonas is buying the land.

examples.text: Nagbakal ako kang bag-o nga sarakyan.
examples.translation: I bought a new car.

examples.text: Ginbakal ni Remo ang amun balay.
examples.translation: Remo bought our house.

examples.text: Mabakal ako kang sapatos.
examples.translation: I am going to buy shoes.

examples.text: Baklun ko ang sapatos.
examples.translation: I will buy shoes.

examples.text: May barakal kaw it tuba dyan?
examples.translation: Do you have money for the coconut wine?

examples.text: Indi run ako kasarang kang mahal nga presyo kang baraklun.
examples.translation: I could not take anymore the high prices of goods.

definitions.definition: a small, hairy animal with a long nose and long tail;

examples.text: May balabaw sa dalum kabinet.
examples.translation: There is a rat under the cabinet.

definitions.definition: a building that is used by people to live in and keep their belongings in

examples.text: May balay nga bag-o lang ginpatindug sa ingud ta.
examples.translation: There is a house newly built in our neighborhood.

examples.text: Tawga na sila Betty kag Anna kay mahampang na ta balay-balay. Ikaw ang nanay, ako ang tatay kag sanda ang bata.
examples.translation: Call Betty and Anna so we could play family roles. You are the mother, I am the father, and they are our children.

examples.text: Balayi run nga daan diya nga lugar kay basi mahinulsul kaw sa urihi.
examples.translation: Build your house here now or you will regret it later.

examples.text: Nag-balay-balay sanda sa likod balay ta.
examples.translation: The children played family roles at the back of our house.

examples.text: Naga-balay-balay ang mga bata sa likod balay ta.
examples.translation: The children are playing family roles at the back of our house.

examples.text: Indi kamo diyan magpatindog balay kay balayan diyan ra kang tag-iya.
examples.translation: Do not build up your house there because the owner of the lot will build his own on that same spot.

examples.text: Ang lupa ni tatay mo sa Mindoro, ginbalayan kang iba.
examples.translation: Informal settlers built their houses on the lot of your father in Mindoro.

definitions.definition: the smelly, salty liquid made by the body because of work or stress

examples.text: Baho ang balhas mo.
examples.translation: Your sweat is stinky.

examples.text: Nagabalhas ang akun iruk.
examples.translation: My armpit sweats.

examples.text: Ginabalhas kaw kalagas kanakun ba.
examples.translation: You are sweating from chasing after me.

examples.text: Nagbalhas ang akon alima.
examples.translation: My hand sweated.

examples.text: Ginbalhas kaw kalagas kanakun ba.
examples.translation: You sweated from chasing after me.

examples.text: Testingi bi kon magbalhas gid man mong iruk.
examples.translation: Try it if you your armpit will indeed sweat.

examples.text: Balhasun kaw gid.
examples.translation: You will surely sweat.

examples.text: Si Kelvin baralhasun nga klase ka bata.
examples.translation: Kelvin is a type of kid who sweats a lot.

definitions.definition: to give away ownership of something in exchange for fair payment or by barter

examples.text: Nagabaligya tana kang saging.
examples.translation: He is selling bananas

examples.text: Ginabaligya nanda ang lupa namun.
examples.translation: They are selling the land of ours

examples.text: Nagbaligya ako kang puto.
examples.translation: I sold a steamed bun

examples.text: Ginbaligya na ang ana nga kulintas.
examples.translation: He sold his necklace

examples.text: Mabaligya si Teng kang isda.
examples.translation: Teng will sell fish

examples.text: Ibaligya ni Roger ang ana balay.
examples.translation: Roger will be selling his house

examples.text: Duro ng baligya ni Kurdapya.
examples.translation: Kurdapya is selling many items.

definitions.definition: about to return

examples.text: Diin kaw run? Manog-balik pa lang ako sa balay.
examples.translation: Where are you now? I am about to return home.

examples.text: Tag-baralik tulad kang mga timbang ta.
examples.translation: Today is the day our helpers will return.

definitions.definition: a mass of water that rises, moves, and falls across the surface of any body of water

examples.text: Taas ang balud kahapon.
examples.translation: The waves were high yesterday.

examples.text: Nagbalud ti taas kaina ang baybay.
examples.translation: The sea sent a big wave earlier today.

examples.text: Rum-an lang ta rigos, naga-balud ti taas ang baybay tulad.
examples.translation: Let us postpone our swimming today because the sea is sending big waves today.

examples.text: May bagyo nga maabot. Mabalud ruman diya ang baybay.
examples.translation: There is an incoming typhoon. For sure, the sea will make big waves.

definitions.definition: a married man; the man whom a woman is married to in a marriage; the legal male partner in a marriage;

examples.text: Ano obra kang bana mo?
examples.translation: What is your husband's work?

examples.text: Si banahun abatun na run ako.
examples.translation: My husband will fetch me now.

examples.text: San-o kaw mamana?
examples.translation: When are you getting married?

definitions.definition: a long, thin thrusting and has a sharp, pointed tip at one end that can be thrown or wielded by hand

examples.text: Nag-bitbit kang bangkaw si Jose sa suba para mangisda.
examples.translation: Jose brought a spear to catch fish in the river.

examples.text: Tatlo ka bendahe ang nagarapta sa kilid dalan.
examples.translation: Three bandages are scattered in the sidewalk.

examples.text: Gin-bangkaw ni Ador ang kaluluoy na nga kontra.
examples.translation: Ador threw a spear to his pitiful enemy.

examples.text: Nabangkaw niya ang kanding sa taramnan kang paray.
examples.translation: He threw a spear to a goat in the rice field.

examples.text: Binangkaw ni Ramon ang pispis nga nagakaun kang ana nga gin-tanum nga mais.
examples.translation: Ramon threw a spear to a bird that eats his corn.

examples.text: Bangkawa ang galutaw nga isda.
examples.translation: You throw the spear to a fish that comes out of the water.

examples.text: Indi kamo magparapit kay Ador, bangkawun na kamo kar-on.
examples.translation: Do not come near Ador or he will throw his spear to you.

definitions.definition: a dead body of a person or animal

examples.text: Nakita nanda ang bangkay sa sulod kang kwarto.
examples.translation: They saw the corpse inside the bedroom.

definitions.definition: a handwoven floor mat made of long leaves that had been cut into strips, air-dried, and folded together

examples.text: Humlada ang banig sa salog.
examples.translation: Spread the sleeping mat on the floor

examples.text: Manog-banig si lola.
examples.translation: My grandmother makes and sells sleeping mats for a living.

examples.text: Natuyo run takun. Pamanig kamo run abi.
examples.translation: I am sleepy. Spread the sleeping mat now.

examples.text: Natuyo kamo run? Mamanig run ako kang salug?
examples.translation: Are you guys sleepy? Shall I spread the sleeping mat on the floor?

examples.text: Banigi niyo ang salog para katurog run kita.
examples.translation: Spread the sleeping mat on the floor so we can sleep.

examples.text: Banigan niyo anay ang salog antis magbatang.
examples.translation: Spread the sleeping mat on the floor before you lie down.

examples.text: Nagapamanig ako kang salog kang nagtawag kaw.
examples.translation: I was spreading the sleeping mat when you called.

examples.text: Nabanigan run namun ang salug.
examples.translation: We already spread a sleeping mat on the floor.

examples.text: Pwede kaw run ka turog sa salog kay ginbanigan run ni papa mo.
examples.translation: You can now sleep on the floor because your father already spread the sleeping mat on it.

examples.text: Natuyo kaw run guid? Danay kaw kay ginabanigan pa ni papa mo ang salog.
examples.translation: Are you very sleepy? Wait for a minute because your father is still putting the sleeping mat on the floor.

definitions.definition: an abnormal growth on a part of one's body

examples.text: Ang banug mo sa tuhod kit-anun.
examples.translation: The swelling on your knee is visible.

examples.text: Nagabanug ang tuhod ko.
examples.translation: My knee is swelling.

examples.text: Kahapon, nagbanug ang tuhod ko.
examples.translation: Yesterday, my knee swelled.

examples.text: Ginpabanug ko ang anang uyahon.
examples.translation: I made her cheek swelled.

examples.text: Mabanug ra kar-on ang tuhod mo nga nakabunggu sa ding-ding
examples.translation: Your knee that knocked the wall will swell later.

examples.text: Ang pilas mo nagabanug.
examples.translation: Your wound is swelling.

examples.text: Ginapabanug ni Jason ang anang tuhod bilang kabahin kang eksperimento.
examples.translation: Jason is making his knee swell as part of the experiment.

examples.text: Pabanugun ko gid mga mata mo.
examples.translation: I will have your eyes swollen.

definitions.definition: a medium or large animal that has fins, a horny beak, and a large, hard shell covering its body and  lives near water;

examples.text: May bao ako nga alaga.
examples.translation: I have a turtle pet.

definitions.definition: having harsh, worn-down, or uneven surface that is uncomfortable to the touch

examples.text: Tam-an ka baraghal ang ana nga alima.
examples.translation: His hands are really rough.

definitions.definition: a mass of fine, loose, and grain-like material made out of worn down rock that covers beaches, river beds, and deserts

examples.text: Nagasipal ang mga bata sa baras.
examples.translation: The children are playing on the sand.

examples.text: Barasun ang baybay.
examples.translation: The beach is sandy.

definitions.definition: to smash a whole solid object into smaller pieces by using force

examples.text: Nagabari si Fatima kang bitlag
examples.translation: Fatima breaks a stick.

examples.text: Ginabari na ang lipak.
examples.translation: She is breaking the stick.

examples.text: Nagbari si lolo kang kawayan.
examples.translation: Grandfather broke a bamboo.

examples.text: Ginbari nanda ang sanga kang kahoy.
examples.translation: They broke the branch of the tree.

examples.text: Mabari kita kang kudal para may garatong.
examples.translation: We will break a fence so that we have a firewood.

examples.text: Gintestingan na barion ang kahoy.
examples.translation: She tried to break the wood.

examples.text: Kamusta run ang bari mo?
examples.translation: How is your broken bone?

examples.text: Masakit sa talinga ang pagbari kang kawayan.
examples.translation: The breaking of the bamboo is unpleasant to the ears.

examples.text: Alima lang kon gamitun nga pangbari.
examples.translation: I will just used my hands in breaking things.

examples.text: May bari ako nga tul-an.
examples.translation: I have a broken bone.

definitions.definition: a small, light seafaring paddling boat with one or two wooden logs attached to the side for better support and stability

examples.text: Gamay nga baroto ang gin-sakyan ko pagkadto ko ridya.
examples.translation: I rode a small boat when I came here.

examples.text: I-baroto na lang kaysa i-pamboat pakadto ridya sa isla.
examples.translation: Ride a small, non-motorizedboat instead of a pump boat on your way to the island.

examples.text: Nag-baroto lang kami.
examples.translation: We rode a small, non- motorized boat.

examples.text: Gin-baroto lang namon pakadto diya sa ila.
examples.translation: We rode a small boat to get into this island.

examples.text: Magkadto sa piyak nga isla, gina-baroto lang namun.
examples.translation: When we go to the neighbor island, we ride a small boat.

examples.text: Ma-baroto lang kami.
examples.translation: We will ride a small, non-motorized boat.

definitions.definition: being covered in or having absorbed liquid

examples.text: Basa akung buhok.
examples.translation: My hair is wet.

examples.text: Ginbasa na akun nga dilargo.
examples.translation: She made my pants wet.

examples.text: Nabasa ang akun nga alima.
examples.translation: My hands got wet.

examples.text: Bul-a ang mga hinugasan nga pinggan sa lababo kay nagabasa kay nagaturo ang gripo.
examples.translation: Get the washed plates out of the sink because they are getting wet from the leaking faucet.

examples.text: Dara kaw ka payong kung indi kaw gusto mabasa.
examples.translation: Bring your umbrella if you don't want go get wet.

examples.text: Bas-a ang salog.
examples.translation: Wash the floor with water.

examples.text: Basyahi ang higku sa lamesa.
examples.translation: Clean up with water those dirt on the table.

examples.text: Kiputon mo baba mo ukon basyahan ta kaw ininit kar-on.
examples.translation: Shut up your mouth or else I will throw you hot water.

examples.text: Ginbasyahan ako ni Rolly ti ramig nga tubig.
examples.translation: Rolly threw me cold water.

examples.text: Tay, ginabasyahan ako tunig ni Rolly.
examples.translation: Dad, Rolly is throwing water on me.

definitions.definition: having great physical power and a solid body

examples.text: Mabaskug ang hangin.
examples.translation: The wind is strong.

examples.text: Baskug-baskug ang uran.
examples.translation: The rain is very strong and heavy.

examples.text: Nagbaskug ang uran.
examples.translation: The rain became stronger.

examples.text: Nagabaskug ang balud sa baybay.
examples.translation: The waves of the sea are becoming stronger

examples.text: Baskuga ang sipa mo.
examples.translation: You kick stronger.

examples.text: Baskugun mo sumbag mo para dasig matumba kontra mo.
examples.translation: Make your punches more powerful to knock-out your enemy very quickly.

examples.text: Pabaskuga ang lawas mo.
examples.translation: You should strengthen your body.

examples.text: Pabaskugun ko danay resistensya ko antis magbalik sa obra.
examples.translation: I will boost my body resistance before I go back to work.

definitions.definition: a person between birth and poverty

examples.text: Bata mo si Ruben?
examples.translation: Is Ruben your child?

examples.text: Si Elena, nakabata run kang subang na.
examples.translation: Elena already gave birth to her first child.

examples.text: Nagbata si Elena kang subang na kahapon.
examples.translation: Elena gave birth to her first child yesterday.

examples.text: Nagabata si Elena kang subang na tulad.
examples.translation: Elena is giving birth to her first child.

examples.text: Nugay ka kadlaw, mabata kaw kar-on ti alang-alang.
examples.translation: Stop laughing or you will be giving birth to a premature baby.

examples.text: Bataun pa ang itsura kang nanay ko.
examples.translation: My mother's face is young-looking.

examples.text: Manak mo ra gale si Andrea? Abi ko tuod mo nga bata.
examples.translation: Is Andrea the child of your husband from another woman? I thought she is your real daughter.

definitions.definition: to move onto or to stay resting on one's back on a given surface

examples.text: Batang diya sa ingud ko.
examples.translation: Lie down beside me.

examples.text: Nagbatang tana sa katre kag nagtugro lagi.
examples.translation: She lay down on the bed and sleep immediately.

examples.text: Nagabatang tana sa bangko.
examples.translation: He is lying down on the chair.

examples.text: Gusto namun mabatang anay.
examples.translation: We want to lie down for a while.

examples.text: Ginpabatang ko ang kabinet.
examples.translation: I laid down the cabinet.

examples.text: Nagalinog. Pabatanga ang aparador kay basi matumba.
examples.translation: There is an earthquake. Lie down the cabinet because it may fall.

examples.text: Buligan ko anay si tatay pabatangun si lolo sa katre na.
examples.translation: I will help my father first to lie down my grandfather on his bed.

examples.text: Sulat kamo pabatang.
examples.translation: Write horizontally.

definitions.definition: a young female human being

examples.text: Bata nga bahi ang gusto kang akun nga bana.
examples.translation: My husband wants a baby girl.

definitions.definition: a young male human being who is not yet fully grown, usually between ages 3 and 11 years old

examples.text: Nagapungko ang bata nga laki sa bangko.
examples.translation: The boy is sitting on the chair.

definitions.definition: to become aware of sound by receiving it with one's ears

examples.text: Ang bati ko kay Esang, may kirida kuno si Elly.
examples.translation: From what I heard from Esang, Elly has a mistress.

examples.text: Mamati ako kanimo.
examples.translation: I will listen to you.

examples.text: Pamatian mo dapat tana.
examples.translation: You shoul listen to her.

examples.text: Nagapamati ang bata.
examples.translation: The child is listening.

examples.text: Batian mo ang hambal ko?
examples.translation: Did you hear what I said?

examples.text: Nabatian ko si tatay kang nag singgit tana inaway.
examples.translation: I heard my father when he shouted fight.

examples.text: Sa mga estudyante sa likod, mabatian niyo limug ko?
examples.translation: To students at the back, can you still hear my voice?

examples.text: Ginapamatian na ang drama sa radyo.
examples.translation: She is listening to the drama in the radio.

examples.text: Kung gapanaw kaw, lantaw sa dalan.
examples.translation: If you are walking, watch your step.

examples.text: Batiun ang limug mo ridya sa balay.
examples.translation: Your voice is loud enough to be heard in our house.

definitions.definition: person to pay close attention to what one is hearing

examples.text: Mamati kita sa ana opinyon.
examples.translation: We will listen to her opinion.

examples.text: Nagapamati kami kang balita.
examples.translation: We listen to the news.

examples.text: Nagpamati si Kalo kanakun.
examples.translation: Kalo listened to me.

examples.text: Pamatian mo man raad kami.
examples.translation: May you also listen to us.

examples.text: Ginapamatian ni Kapitan ang anda istorya.
examples.translation: Kapitan is listening to their story.

examples.text: Ginpamatian ni Aying ang tunog sa kisame.
examples.translation: Aying listened to the sound at the ceiling.

definitions.definition: a hard, solid mass of material that forms the earth

examples.text: Nagpungko si Mitch sa bato.
examples.translation: Mitch sat down on a rock.

examples.text: Batohon ang karsada.
examples.translation: The road is so rocky.

definitions.definition: the sister or brother of one's married partner;

examples.text: Bayaw ko si Arnold.
examples.translation: Arnold is my brother-in-law.

definitions.definition: the sister or brother of one's married partner; the wife or husband of one's married sibling

examples.text: Bayaw mo si Melvic?
examples.translation: Is Melvic your brother-in-law?

definitions.definition: a large body of salt water the surrounds the land;

examples.text: Hadluk tana sa baybay.
examples.translation: He's afraid of the sea.

definitions.definition: clothes made of piña fiber that is worn on the upper body

examples.text: Diin mo gin-bakal imo nga bayo?
examples.translation: Where did you buy your clothe?

examples.text: Kuwa-i ko bayo sa bayu-an ko.
examples.translation: Get me a shirt in my closet.

examples.text: Nagbayo sanda kang itum kang lubong ni Nardo.
examples.translation: They wore black during the burial of Nardo.

examples.text: Mabayu kita ka pula sa atun nga class reunion.
examples.translation: We will dress in red in our class reunion.

examples.text: Bayu-an ta siya kang ga-idlak-idlak nga bayo.
examples.translation: Let us dress her with a shining clothe.

examples.text: Pabayu-i si Inday ti pula nga bayo sa birthday na.
examples.translation: You make Inday wear a red dress on her birthday.

examples.text: Napabayu-an niyo si Nene kang nami?
examples.translation: Did you dress Nene with a beautiful clothe?

examples.text: Pabayu-an niyo si Papa kang pula nga bayo sa ana nga birthay.
examples.translation: Dress our father with with a red clothe on his birthday.

examples.text: Ginpabayu-an ni Mama si manang kang puti.
examples.translation: Our mother dressed our eldest sister with a white clothe.

definitions.definition: to hit something heavily many times with one's own hands or with an object;

examples.text: Nagabayo ang lola kang paray.
examples.translation: The grandmother pounds the rice grains.

examples.text: Ginabayo na ang mais.
examples.translation: He is pounding the corn kernels.

examples.text: Nagbayo kang mais si Atong.
examples.translation: Atong pounded the corn kernels.

examples.text: Ginbayo na ang kape.
examples.translation: He pounded the coffee beans.

examples.text: Mabayo kita.
examples.translation: Let’s pound.

examples.text: Bayuhon ko ang mani.
examples.translation: I will grind the peanuts.

examples.text: Hinayi lang ang pagbayo.
examples.translation: Pound it slowly.

examples.text: Mayad hay dya ikaw, may manugbayo.
examples.translation: Good thing you’re here there’s somebody who will pound.

definitions.definition: to put a bandage into something or to wrap something with a bandage usually a wound or a fractured bone

examples.text: Gamita ra ang tela, I-bendahe sa bari mo nga lima.
examples.translation: Use that cloth to bandage around your fractured hand.

examples.text: Nabatian mo ang natabo kay Raul? Gin-bendahe ang ulo na kay nakabunggo sa dingding.
examples.translation: Did you hear what happened to Raul? He got a bandage around his head after he knocked his head on the wall.

definitions.definition: one of the two fleshy folds that surround the upper and lower parts of mouth

examples.text: Nakagat ko ang akun nga bibig.
examples.translation: I bit my lip.

definitions.definition: females the sex organ found on the lower body between the base of the legs, in front of the buttocks, and extends to the uterus inside the body

examples.text: Ang bilat mo ay nagapula.
examples.translation: Your vagina is reddish.

examples.text: Ang bilatan mo nga bata ay, ga-biga-biga liwat sa iban nga laki.
examples.translation: Look at your flirty/promiscuous daughter, she is flirting with some other guys.

definitions.definition: the stretch of land that borders the sea and the rest of the inland areas

examples.text: Nakakita ako kang nami nga bato sa binit- baybay.
examples.translation: I found a beautiful stone on the shore.

definitions.definition: an alcoholic drink made from the fermented juice of certain fruits or vegetables

examples.text: Ang tinapay kag bino gasimbolo kang lawas kag dugo ni Kristo.
examples.translation: The bread and wine symbolize the body and blood of Christ.

definitions.definition: the female parent of one's married partner;

examples.text: Si biras ko Ellen ang nagbayad anay kang amun nga kuryente.
examples.translation: The spouse of my spouse's sibling, Ellen, paid our electric bill.

examples.text: Si Ellen kag Marevic, magbiras. Si Ellen asawa ni Eric, subang ni Elsy kag si Marevic asawa ni Ryan, agot ni Elsy.
examples.translation: Ellen and Marevic are related by their husbands who are brothers. Ellen is Eric's wife, the eldest of Elsy, while Marevic is Ryan's wife, youngest of Elsy.

definitions.definition: to hold and lift something to be moved to a given location

examples.text: Ginbitbit imo gamit kagab-i.
examples.translation: Your things were carried last night.

examples.text: Pag-uli ko ka gab-i, nagbitbit ko kawayan para sa mga layaw nga ayam.
examples.translation: When I was on my way home last night, I brought a stick to use against stray dogs.

examples.text: Ginabitbit kang bata ang instrumento.
examples.translation: The child is carrying the instrument.

examples.text: Hambal ni sir, mabitbit kuno kita rum-an kang mga libro halin sa classroom paagto sa library.
examples.translation: Sir said that we will carry books from our classroom to the library tomorrow.

examples.text: Bitbita ang ginpamakal ta.
examples.translation: You carry our groceries.

examples.text: Bitbitun ko ang basket nga puno kang pagkaun.
examples.translation: I will carry the basket that is full of food.

examples.text: Ano biritbitun diya kara?
examples.translation: What things should I carry from here?

definitions.definition: a large, hard-skinned, meat-eating animal that lives near hot, and humid bodies of water ;

examples.text: Nakakita ko ka buaya sa suba.
examples.translation: I saw a crocodile in the river.

definitions.definition: having more weight that it makes something or someone harder to carry or move

examples.text: Bug-at ang sako.
examples.translation: The sack is heavy.

examples.text: Bug-at darhun ang natabo.
examples.translation: What happened is heavy burden.

examples.text: Bug-at-bug-at ang bangkay.
examples.translation: The cadaver is very heavy.

definitions.definition: the property of being comparatively great in weight

examples.text: Ang kabug-atun kang abo amu ang dahilan kang pagkawasak kang bubong.
examples.translation: The heaviness of the ash is the cause of the destruction of the roof.

definitions.definition: a stick of wood with a long handle on one end and a broad flattened part on the other, and is used for moving a boat through water

examples.text: Mahuram anay ako ka bugsay sa piyak balay.
examples.translation: I will borrow a paddle from our neighborhood.

examples.text: Si toto lang taga-busay ta.
examples.translation: Toto will be the one paddling our boat.

examples.text: Gin-bugsay lang nanda ang baroto para ka tabok sa isla.
examples.translation: They paddled the boat on their way to the island.

examples.text: Magkadto sa isla, ginabugsay lang namon.
examples.translation: When we go to the island, we are rowing a small boat.

examples.text: Naga-bugsay sanda tulad kang baroto pakadto sa piyak barrio.
examples.translation: They are now paddling the boat to go to the next island.

examples.text: Bugsaya ti todo ang baroto.
examples.translation: You row the boat stronger.

examples.text: Bugsayi ako anay.
examples.translation: You paddle the boat for me.

examples.text: Kung magkadto ta sa piyak nga isla, bugsayun ta lang.
examples.translation: If we go to the neighbor island, we will just ride a small boat and paddle.

definitions.definition: being aware and active when not sleeping

examples.text: Bugtaw run si tatay.
examples.translation: Father is awake.

examples.text: Bugtaw run kamo.
examples.translation: Wake up everyone.

examples.text: Nagbugtaw run ang bata ko nga gwapo.
examples.translation: My handsome child woke up.

examples.text: Bugtawa ako kar-on mga alas singko sa hapon.
examples.translation: Please wake me up around 5 o'clock in the afternoon.

examples.text: Kar-on mag alas-singko sa aga, bugtawun mo ako ha.
examples.translation: Later at 5 o'clock AM, wake me up.

examples.text: Nabugtawan ako kang gahud sa tupad balay.
examples.translation: I was awakened by the noise from our neighborhood.

examples.text: Humandam kamo kanakun kung mabugtawan ako kang kagahud niyo, tampuyungon ko guid baba niyo.
examples.translation: I am warning you, if I will be roused by your noise, I will slap your mouth.

examples.text: Taga-aga, nagakabugtawan ako sa gahud kang mga ayam kang tupad balay.
examples.translation: I am waking up at the noise of my neighbor's dogs every morning.

definitions.definition: one's brother/s or sister/s;

examples.text: Ano ngaran kang bugto mo?
examples.translation: What is the name of your sibling?

examples.text: Si Andrew kag Bert magbugto.
examples.translation: Andrew and Bert are siblings.

definitions.definition: to perform and finish a given action

examples.text: Nagabuhat tana kang basket.
examples.translation: He makes a basket.

examples.text: Ginabuhat na kadya ang basket
examples.translation: She is doing the basket

examples.text: Nagbuhat kang tuturugan si Allan.
examples.translation: Allan made a sleeping area.

examples.text: Ginbuhat ni Nene nga hampangan ang inutod nga kahoy.
examples.translation: Nene made the cut tree into a toy.

examples.text: Mabuhat kita kang bangkaw.
examples.translation: We will make a spear.

examples.text: Kinahanglan nga buhatun mo ang imo trabaho.
examples.translation: You need to do your job.

examples.text: Ana buhat ni Tingting ran.
examples.translation: It is Tingting's work.

examples.text: Haros malain ang imo mga binuhatan
examples.translation: Most of your actions are bad.

definitions.definition: having life; living

examples.text: Indi kaw magkahadluk, buhi ang Gino-o.
examples.translation: Do not be afraid, God is alive.

examples.text: Sa pangabuhi, may ara pirme kasadya tapos kang kasubo.
examples.translation: In life, there is happiness after sadness.

examples.text: Ang kabuhi daw pareho kang binhi.
examples.translation: Life is like a seed.

examples.text: Ang pagpangisda ang pangabuhian ko.
examples.translation: Fishing is my livelihood.

examples.text: Kasarang kaw run mangabuhi nga sarahanun?
examples.translation: Are you capable of making a living on your own?

examples.text: Nagapangabuhi sanda sa Manila.
examples.translation: We are living in Manila.

examples.text: Nagpangabuhi ako nga sarahanun sa lima ka tuig.
examples.translation: I lived by myself for five years.

examples.text: Indi kaw magkabalaka, mabuhi ta ikaw.
examples.translation: Do not worry, I can support you.

examples.text: Buhiun ta ikaw tub-tub sa masarangan ko.
examples.translation: I will raise you for as long as I can.

examples.text: Dok, palihog obraha ang tanan. Buhia ang bata ko.
examples.translation: Doc, please do everything. Revive my child.

definitions.definition: having a life in order to function and grow;

examples.text: Buhi sa gihapon ang nagpatay kay nanay.
examples.translation: The murderer of my mother is still alive.

examples.text: Andut nabuhi pa ako?
examples.translation: Why am I still alive?

examples.text: Ginbuhi ni Hesus si Lazaro halin sa mga minatay.
examples.translation: Jesus had resurrected Lazaro from the land of the dead.

examples.text: Ginbuhi ta ikaw hay palangga ko ikaw.
examples.translation: I provided for your needs because I love you.

examples.text: Buhiun ko kamo tungud nanay niyo ako.
examples.translation: I will raise you beacause I'm your mother.

examples.text: Sa pihak kang pagtiraw, nabuhian gyapon ka paglaum ang bata para malab-ot ang anang handum
examples.translation: The child is still hopeful inspite of challenges in her/his life.

definitions.definition: a hollow opening in the ground or any other solid surface

examples.text: May buho ang akun bayo.
examples.translation: I have a hole in my dress.

examples.text: Nagabuho sanda.
examples.translation: They are making a hole.

examples.text: Nagbuho ako kang akun paranaguan.
examples.translation: I made a hole as a place to hide.

examples.text: Mabuho kita lagi.
examples.translation: We will make a hole right now.

examples.text: Kinanglan buhuan ang kasilyas.
examples.translation: There is a need to make a hole on the bathroom.

examples.text: Ginabuhuan kang mga kawatan ang pader.
examples.translation: The robbers are making a hole on the wall.

examples.text: Ginbuhuan ni Jimmy ang gawang.
examples.translation: Jimmy made a hole at the door.

definitions.definition: the thin, fine, thread-like growths that cover many parts of the body like the head, the face, and others

examples.text: Malabug kag malagtum ang buhok ni Lea.
examples.translation: Lea has long black hair.

examples.text: Mabuhok ang lapsag.
examples.translation: The infant is hairy.

definitions.definition: a mass of bubbles that forms on water when it flows and is stirred

examples.text: Nag-arawas ang bukal kang beer sa baso.
examples.translation: Foam bubbled up from the glass of beer.

definitions.definition: to heat liquids in a container by using an open fire;

examples.text: Nagapabukal si nanay kang tubig.
examples.translation: Mother boils water.

examples.text: Nagpabukal tana kang tubi para kanatun.
examples.translation: He boiled water for us.

examples.text: Kinanglan ta magpabukal kang tubi.
examples.translation: There is a need to boil water.

examples.text: Ginapabukalan ni Tongtong ang sopas.
examples.translation: Tontong boiled the soup.

examples.text: Ginpabukalan ni Iya ang tinola.
examples.translation: Iya boiled the tinola.

examples.text: Una sa tanan, pabukalun mo anay ang tubi.
examples.translation: First of all, let the water boil.

examples.text: Ang pagpabukal kang tubi ang pinakahapus nga ubra para kanakun.
examples.translation: Boiling water is the easiest chore for me.

definitions.definition: refers to something to be opened

examples.text: Bukas pa ang tyangge?
examples.translation: Is the store open?

examples.text: Diin diya kara ang buruksan nga lata?
examples.translation: Which among these canned good shall I open?

definitions.definition: to move or adjust something to allow access and viewing

examples.text: Buksan mo ang gawang.
examples.translation: Open the door.

examples.text: Buksi ang gawang.
examples.translation: Open the door.

examples.text: Ginbuksan na ang bintana.
examples.translation: She opened the window.

examples.text: Ginabuksan na ang gawang.
examples.translation: He is opening the door.

examples.text: Nabuksan ko ang regalo para kay Mikee. Abi ko bi akun.
examples.translation: I acidentally opened the gift for Mikee. I thought it was mine.

definitions.definition: being unable to see or sense things through the eyes

examples.text: Bulag ako.
examples.translation: I'm blind.

examples.text: Ginbulag tana kang sobra nga pagpalangga.
examples.translation: She was blinded by so much love.

examples.text: Daw mabulag ako sa kasanag kang adlaw.
examples.translation: I feel like I will be blinded by the light of the sun.

examples.text: Nabulag ang ana mata sa sobra ka kapoy.
examples.translation: She was blind due to overfatigue.

examples.text: Bulagun ikaw ka ra kang buhay nga pag-gamit computer.
examples.translation: Using computer for hours will blind you.

definitions.definition: a type of plant that grows curls of colorful petals at the end of its stems;

examples.text: Kahamot kang mga bulak.
examples.translation: The flowers smell very good.

examples.text: Namulak ang lemon ko.
examples.translation: My lemon flowered.

examples.text: San-o pa diya mamulak ang cactus ko man?
examples.translation: When will my cactus flower?

examples.text: Nagapamulak ang mangga.
examples.translation: The mango tree is flowering.

examples.text: Dara kamo kang nagapamulak nga tanum.
examples.translation: You all bring flowering plants.

definitions.definition: the pale, glowing ball that moves across the sky that gives dim light during the night;

examples.text: Gusto ko makita ang bulan sa gwa.
examples.translation: I want to see the moon outside.

definitions.definition: a period of time of around four weeks

examples.text: Mapanaw ako sa Manila sunod bulan.
examples.translation: I will go to Manila next month.

examples.text: Sa Oktobre  nga dya ang ana kabulanan.
examples.translation: She is due to give birth this October

examples.text: May bulanan tana nga baraydan sa bangko.
examples.translation: She has monthly remittance at the bank.

definitions.definition: happening every month

examples.text: Nagapadara tana kang kwarta sa anang pamilya bulan-bulan.
examples.translation: He sent money to his family every month.

definitions.definition: a shiny, yellowish metal mined from the ground that is precious and valuable;

examples.text: Tuod ra nga bulawan?
examples.translation: Is that pure gold?

examples.text: Bulawanun ang anang tagipusuon.
examples.translation: He has a heart of gold.

definitions.definition: the short, fine hair that covers the bodies of some animals

examples.text: Gataktak ang bulbul kang kuring mo.
examples.translation: Your cat's fur is shedding.

examples.text: Pabukali kag bulbuli ang manok para sa tinola nga manok.
examples.translation: Boil and remove the feather of the chicken for the chicken soup.

examples.text: Kagab-i, nagpamulbol kang manok si Intang.
examples.translation: Last night, Intang removed the feathers of the chicken.

examples.text: Nagapamulbol kang pato si Juan.
examples.translation: Juan is removing the feathers of the duck.

examples.text: Ginabulbulan nanda ang pato.
examples.translation: They are having the feathers of the duck removed.

examples.text: Nabulbulan mo run ang manok para sa tinola nga manok?
examples.translation: Have you removed the feathers of chicken for the chicken soup?

examples.text: Ginbulbulan mo ang manok para sa tinola nga manok?
examples.translation: Did you remove the feathers of chicken for the chicken soup?

examples.text: Ang bata bala ni Andie bulbulanan.
examples.translation: Andie's child is hairy.

definitions.definition: the two fleshy curves on the lower back of the body

examples.text: Ginturukan ang akun nga buli.
examples.translation: I had an injection in my buttocks.

examples.text: Bulian nga klase bahi si Maribel.
examples.translation: Maribel has big buttocks.

examples.text: Indi ko mabaton nga ginbuli ako kang akun abyan tungud lang dungug.
examples.translation: I could not accept that my close friend betrayed me just because of pride.

definitions.definition: a scientifically-proven substance or treatment used for preventing or curing a disease or sickness

examples.text: Epektibo dya nga bulong sa sakit ulo.
examples.translation: This medicine is effective reliever of headache.

examples.text: Ang tatay ni Layla ang manami nga manog-bulong sa banwa kang Guimbal.
examples.translation: Layla's father is the best quack doctor in the town of Guimbal.

examples.text: Gin-bulong ko run ang pilas ko.
examples.translation: I already treated my wound.

examples.text: Ma-late daw si Arnie abot kay ginabulong na pa pilas na sa kahig.
examples.translation: Arnie will arrive late because he is still treating his wound on his leg.

examples.text: Masunod kaw sa Sitio Irik-Ikan? Mangbulong ako to kang may mga sakit.
examples.translation: Do you want to join me to go to Sitio Irik-Ikan? I will attend to the medical needs of the people there.

examples.text: Bulonga ang pilas mo.
examples.translation: You treat your wound.

examples.text: Bulungi ti oinment ang pilas mo.
examples.translation: You put an ointment to heal your wound.

examples.text: Bulongon mo liwat kar-on ang pilas mo.
examples.translation: You will treat your wound again later.

examples.text: Nagpabulong ako kay Dr. Neodama.
examples.translation: My medication was attended by Dr. Neodama.

examples.text: Sa Manila, nagapangbulong si manang kang may sakit.
examples.translation: In Manila, my elder sister gives treatment to sick people.

definitions.definition: to quickly hit a part of someone's body as punishment for something they did wrong

examples.text: Rogto tana sa likod, nagabunal sa anang pasaway nga bata.
examples.translation: She is at the back, beating her disobedient child.

examples.text: Ginabunal kang tawo ang ana kontra.
examples.translation: The person is beating his enemy.

examples.text: Tana ang nabunal kanakun.
examples.translation: He was the one who beat me.

examples.text: Ginbunal ako bisan owa kang dahilan.
examples.translation: I was beaten for no reason.

examples.text: Kon ibunal ko dya kanimo, sugot kaw?
examples.translation: If i will beat you this, will you agree?

examples.text: Bunalun ko guid ikaw kar-on.
examples.translation: I will beat you later.

examples.text: Indi ko makita ang burunal.
examples.translation: I can't find the beaitng stick.

examples.text: Ang pagbunal sa bata indi manami.
examples.translation: Beating a child is not good.

definitions.definition: being unable to hear or sense sounds though the ears

examples.text: Indi na kaw mabatian kay bungol ria.
examples.translation: She can't hear you because she is deaf.

examples.text: Mapabungol-bungol lang ta kung karaan kita ta ni mama
examples.translation: We will pretend not hearing anything if our mother will scold us.

examples.text: Kung sukton na ikaw gani kang bayad, pabungol-bungoli lang.
examples.translation: If she will ask for your payment, ignore her.

examples.text: Nagpabungol-bungol liwat si Elsa kang gin-sukot ko kang utang na.
examples.translation: Elsa pretended not to hear me when I asked her to pay her debt.

examples.text: Hoy! Baydi ang utang mo. Indi ako pagpabungol-bungoli.
examples.translation: Hey! You pay what you owe me. Do not pretend as if you don't hear me.

definitions.definition: mostly males the growing hair on one's face that grows on the chin, the cheeks, the sides, and throat

examples.text: Ginbuhinan ni Roy ang ana nga bungut.
examples.translation: Roy trimmed his moustache.

examples.text: Gasakit akun busong kung magkadlaw.
examples.translation: My stomach hurts when I laugh.

examples.text: Nahadlukan ang mga bata kang nakita nanda ang mal-am nga bungutun.
examples.translation: The children were frightened when they saw an old man having a long moustache.

definitions.definition: to use clear water to remove soap or other dirt from something or someone

examples.text: Nagabunlaw si Pitok kang ana linabhan.
examples.translation: Pitoy rinses his washed clothes.

examples.text: Nagbunlaw ako kang akon kahig.
examples.translation: I rinsed my feet.

examples.text: Mabunlaw ta kang linabhan.
examples.translation: Let us rinse our washed clothes.

examples.text: Bunlawan ko anay ang lapsag.
examples.translation: I need to have the baby rinsed first.

examples.text: Bunlawi alima mo kang tubig.
examples.translation: Rinse you hands with water.

examples.text: Ginabunlawan na anang alima.
examples.translation: He is rinsing his hands.

examples.text: Ginbunlawan na ang linabhan.
examples.translation: She had rinsed off the washed clothes.

examples.text: Nami kung tubi ang pangbunlaw.
examples.translation: It will be good if water will be used as rinse.

examples.text: Ang pagbunlaw dapat mauti.
examples.translation: Rinsing should be thorough.

definitions.definition: to use a sharp object to attack, wound, or even kill someone

examples.text: Nagabuno si Ame kang kontra na.
examples.translation: Ame is stabing her enemy.

examples.text: Ginabuno mo tana haw?
examples.translation: Why are you stabing him?

examples.text: Nakita ko tana nga nagbuno sa lingin.
examples.translation: I witnessed him stabbed the drunk person.

examples.text: Ginbuno na ang kawatan.
examples.translation: He stabbed the thief.

examples.text: Mabuno ko gid ikaw.
examples.translation: I might stab you.

examples.text: Bun-on ko ikaw!
examples.translation: I will stab you.

examples.text: Raku ang buno sa lawas ni Betong.
examples.translation: There are lots of stab wounds in Betong’s body.

examples.text: Tana ria ang manugbuno kon wara ti mangako.
examples.translation: He is the one who will stab if no one else does.

definitions.definition: the part of the lower body that connects the foot and the leg that one can twist and bend at the joint

examples.text: Kinanglan operahan ang buol ni Anne.
examples.translation: Anne needs an operation on her ankle.

definitions.definition: being satisfied after eating enough food and drink

examples.text: Busog ako antis magkadto diya.
examples.translation: I am full before I came here.

examples.text: Busog-busog ako ka kaon saging.
examples.translation: I am very full eating bananas.

examples.text: Gin-busog ako ka kaon dulsi.
examples.translation: I was made full by eating candies.

examples.text: Nabusog ako ka panginaun kang mais ni Linda.
examples.translation: I got full eating Linda's corn.

examples.text: Salamat guid langga. Ginabusog mo guid ako sa pagpalangga.
examples.translation: Thank you, love. You are always making me feel full of love.

examples.text: Nugay kakaun dulsi, mabusog kaw kar-on wara pa tag-irigma.
examples.translation: Stop eating candies or  you will be full by the time we have our lunch.

examples.text: Busuga kaugalingon mo kakaun antis kita magpanaw pa syudad.
examples.translation: Make youself full before we leave for the city.

examples.text: Kung ako pakaslan mo, busgon ta guid ikaw kang pagpalangga.
examples.translation: If you marry me, I will make you feel full of love.

definitions.definition: the front part of the upper body that lies between the chest and the pelvis

examples.text: Gasakit akun busong kung magkadlaw.
examples.translation: My stomach hurts when I laugh.

definitions.definition: the internal organ found in the abdomen that receives and digests food

examples.text: Gasakit ang akun busong.
examples.translation: My stomach is aching.

definitions.definition: having the most amount of objects or persons that can fit in a given place

examples.text: Buta ang trak kang karga nga tubo.
examples.translation: The truck was carrying a full load of sugarcane.

examples.text: Buta-buta run ang sako.
examples.translation: The sack is already full.

definitions.definition: anything that contains or can contain anything

examples.text: Kilanlan mo ibalik ang libro tapos mo basa.
examples.translation: You need to return the book after you read it.

examples.text: Nagbalik tana sa andang probinsiya.
examples.translation: He returned to his province.

examples.text: Ginabalik ko lang ang pabor ka na.
examples.translation: I'm just returning the favor to him.

examples.text: May burutangan kaw kang kan-on?
examples.translation: Do you have a container for rice?

definitions.definition: an expression of something that is not true or not based on facts;

examples.text: Ano nga butig ang ginahambal mo?
examples.translation: What lie are you saying?

examples.text: Naga nga nagabutig ikaw kanakun?
examples.translation: Why are you lying to me?

examples.text: Nagbutig si Glen kay Arvie.
examples.translation: Glen lied to Arvie.

examples.text: Sin-o nagtudlo kanimo nga magbutig kanakun?
examples.translation: Who taught you to lie to me?

examples.text: Butigun ikaw!
examples.translation: You are a liar!

definitions.definition: the part of the upper body that stretches between shoulder and wrist, and can be bent at the elbow

examples.text: Sakit kamayad ang akun nga butkun.
examples.translation: My arm hurts a lot.

definitions.definition: the male sex organ found on the lower body between the base of the legs, above the testicles, and in front of the buttocks; usually used to refer to large penis

examples.text: Kinanglan ta nga paltakun ang imo nga buto.
examples.translation: We need to circumcumcise your penis.

examples.text: Ka gamay ka pitoy mo.
examples.translation: Your penis is small.

definitions.definition: to pull something forcefully along the ground to a given location;

examples.text: Gulpi na lang ako ginbutung sa bangko.
examples.translation: He suddenly dragged me from my chair.

examples.text: Nabutung ko ang kuryente.
examples.translation: I dragged the wire accidentally.

examples.text: Ginabutung na ang pala.
examples.translation: She is dragging the shovel.

examples.text: Butunga buhok na.
examples.translation: Pull her hair.

examples.text: Butungun ta kaw padalom.
examples.translation: I will drag you down.

definitions.definition: to move or adjust something to allow access and viewing

examples.text: Ginbutung na ang gawang.
examples.translation: She pulled the door.

examples.text: Ginabutung ni Bong kag Billy ang lubid.
examples.translation: Bong ang Billy are pulling the rope.

examples.text: Kinanglan da butungun ang tabon bago sanda makaguwa.
examples.translation: They need to pull down the cover before they can go out.

examples.text: Manapas ta kang kahoy. Ikaw manog-butung kang kahoy kung mautod kag magtumba.
examples.translation: Let us cut trees. You will pull the tree when it is cut and falls down on the ground

examples.text: Itulod mo para magdalagan.
examples.translation: Push it so that it will run.

examples.text: Gintulod nanda ang baroto paagto sa dagat.
examples.translation: They pushed the boat to the sea.

definitions.definition: an object having been around or had been used for a long time;

examples.text: Ginbisita namun ang daan nga library.
examples.translation: We visited the old library.

examples.text: Daw nag-daan turukun ang balay mo kay wara mo ginalimpyohan.
examples.translation: Your house looked old because you never clean it.

examples.text: Naga-daan ang sarakyan kung pirme ginagamit.
examples.translation: A vehicle that is frequently used gets old quickly.

examples.text: Kung mag-daan ang pinta kang sarakyan mo, darha ridya sa carshop ko.
examples.translation: If your paint of your car gets old, bring it to my carshop.

definitions.definition: a light gentle rain that falls in a fine, steady sprinkle

examples.text: Hindi na run kinanglan magdara kang payong kay hinay lang man ang dabo-dabo.
examples.translation: The drizzle was so light that she didn't need to bring an umbrella.

examples.text: Nag-dabo-dabo kaina nga tag-irigma.
examples.translation: It drizzled during lunchtime.

examples.text: Indi mag-gwa sa balay, naga-dabo-dabo sagwa.
examples.translation: Do not go out of the house, it is drizzling outside.

examples.text: Magal-umun ang langit, daw ma-dabo-dabo run. Sulod kamo sa balay.
examples.translation: The sky is dark and it is about to drizzle. Get inside the house.

examples.text: Nadabo-dabohan ang mga linabhan sagwa balay.
examples.translation: The washed clothes outside the house were drizzled.

examples.text: Pasudla run nga daan ang mga linabhan kay basi madabo-dabohan kay gadulum ang langit.
examples.translation: Bring the washed clothes inside the house because it might be drizzled later as the sky is turning dark.

definitions.definition: a small, thin, polished metal tool with a sharp point on one end and a hole to tie thread with on the other

examples.text: May dagum sa dalum katre.
examples.translation: There is a needle under the bed.

definitions.definition: the loud, rumbling, and crashing sound that follows after a flash of lightning

examples.text: Nagbugtaw ako tungud sa daguob.
examples.translation: I woke up because of the sound of thunder.

examples.text: Nagdaguob ang langit asta mag kaagahon.
examples.translation: The sky thundered until dawn.

examples.text: Nagadaguob kag naga uran sa sagwa.
examples.translation: It was thundering and raining outside.

examples.text: nagadulom ang langit. Mangilat kag madauob guid diya karon mong.
examples.translation: The sky is dark. For sure, there will be lightning and thunder later.

definitions.definition: the hairless upper front part of the head that is above the face, below the hairline, and between either temples

examples.text: Gin harukan ni Vince ang akun nga dahi.
examples.translation: Vince kissed my forehead.

definitions.definition: the flat part of plants that grow at the ends of its stems or branches;

examples.text: Buta ka dahon ang atup ta.
examples.translation: Our roof is full of leaves.

definitions.definition: to stop someone and to take them into custody

examples.text: Dakpa tana.
examples.translation: Catch him.

examples.text: Gindakup kang polis ang tatay na.
examples.translation: His father was caught by the police.

examples.text: Mangdakup ta pispis.
examples.translation: Let us catch birds.

examples.text: Gusto ko dakpun ang kriminal.
examples.translation: I want to catch the criminal.

examples.text: Nadakpan ako kang akun maestra nga gapanghuwad.
examples.translation: My teacher caught me cheating.

definitions.definition: a person who arrests/abducts someone or catches something

examples.text: Mga bata, indi kamo maggwa sa balay. May manog-dakop kang mga bata nga nagalagaw.
examples.translation: Children, do not go out of the house. There is someone roaming in our area who abducts children.

examples.text: Si Maria Labo, nagapangdakop bata.
examples.translation: Maria labo abducts children.

examples.text: Nakatakas roman sa mga otoridad ang darakpun nga tawo
examples.translation: The person to be arrested has eluded the authorities again.

definitions.definition: to use one's legs and feet to move quickly from one place to another

examples.text: Dalagan!
examples.translation: Run!

examples.text: Nagdalagan ang ayam sa pihak karsada.
examples.translation: The dog ran across the road

examples.text: Madalagan tana sa katapusan nga kompetisyon.
examples.translation: He will run in the final competition.

examples.text: Nagauran. Wara ako ti payong. Dalaganun ko na lang mag-uli.
examples.translation: It is raining. I don't have an umbrella. I'll just run on my way home.

examples.text: Kang naglupok ang tangke, nagdaralagan ang mga tawo.
examples.translation: When the tank exploded, people ran.

examples.text: Nagadalagan tana sa plaza.
examples.translation: He's running in the plaza.

examples.text: Kakita ko kang gadaralagan nga mga tawo sa plaza.
examples.translation: I saw running people in the plaza.

definitions.definition: a long, open stretch of paved or beaten ground that people use to travel from place to place

examples.text: Ridyan kita nga dalan maagi mag-uli kar-on.
examples.translation: We will use that road on our way home later.

definitions.definition: far down from the top

examples.text: Dalom ang baybay.
examples.translation: The sea is deep.

definitions.definition: a thing is below something

examples.text: Ang ayam nagapanago sa dalum kang lamesa.
examples.translation: The dog is hiding under the table.

definitions.definition: having large amount of depth;

examples.text: Dalum ang suba.
examples.translation: The river is deep.

examples.text: Nugay agto sa dalum.
examples.translation: Do not go in the deep.

examples.text: Nagadalum ang suba.
examples.translation: The river is getting deeper.

examples.text: Ginapadalum nanda ang suba.
examples.translation: They are making the river deeper.

examples.text: Nagdalum ang suba.
examples.translation: The river got deeper.

examples.text: Magadalum ang suba kon mananum kita kahoy..
examples.translation: The river will get deeper if we will plant trees.

examples.text: Ginpadalum nanda ang suba.
examples.translation: They made the river deeper.

examples.text: Kinanglan natun padalumun ang suba.
examples.translation: We need to make the river deeper.

definitions.definition: a small insect-like animal that has eight long legs and biting fangs, and can produce threads of silk to build webs with;

examples.text: May damang sa kisame.
examples.translation: There is a spider on the ceiling.
