examples.text: May mga anay ang daan nga balay.
examples.translation: The old house has termites.

definitions.definition: the mental images one imagines when asleep

examples.text: Karadlawan ang damgo ko kagab-i.
examples.translation: My dream last night was funny.

examples.text: Nag-damgo ako kang raw-ay kagab-i.
examples.translation: I dreamt of something bad last night.

examples.text: Gindamgo ko ikaw.
examples.translation: I dreamt of you.

examples.text: Naga nga ginadamgo ta ikaw kada gabi-i?
examples.translation: Why do I dream about you every night?

examples.text: Damguhon ta ikaw magturog ako kar-on sa gab-i.
examples.translation: I will dream of you when I sleep tonight.

examples.text: Nadamguhan ko ang napatay nga tupad balay ta.
examples.translation: I dreamt of our deceased neighbor.

examples.text: Madamguhan mo guid kar-on ang murto sa ginalantaw mo nga movie.
examples.translation: Later, you will dream about that horror film you are watching.

definitions.definition: the mental images one imagines when asleep

examples.text: Nami damgo ko ka gab-i, nakapangasawa kuno ako kang manggaranun.
examples.translation: I had a good dream last night that I got married to a wealthy man.

examples.text: Nag-damgo ako kagab-i nga nagdaug kuno ako ti dyes mil.
examples.translation: Last night, I dreamt that I won ten thousand pesos.

examples.text: Damguha lang ang palangga mo para indi kaw masubuan.
examples.translation: Just imagine your lover in your dream so you don't get sad.

examples.text: Nadamguhan ta ikaw kagab-i.
examples.translation: I dreamt of you last night.

examples.text: Tani, madamguhan ko kar-on sa gab-e si Exl.
examples.translation: I wish, I will think about Exl in my dream tonight

definitions.definition: being full of and packed with objects or materials;

examples.text: Nagkaon ako kang damul nga kiniwa nga karne.
examples.translation: I ate thick cuts of meat.

examples.text: Damula ang kiray mo.
examples.translation: Thicken your eyebrows.

examples.text: Damulun mo agi mo magsulat.
examples.translation: Thicken your writing.

examples.text: Gindamulan ko ang kiray ni Nita.
examples.translation: I thickened Nita's eyebrows

examples.text: Gindamul ko ang sulat ko.
examples.translation: I boldened my writing.

definitions.definition: the flat underside of the feet that does not include the heel

examples.text: May kibul ako sa dapa-dapa kang akun nga kahig.
examples.translation: I have a callus on the sole of my foot.

definitions.definition: to take someone or move something to a given location;

examples.text: Dar-a ang baso.
examples.translation: Bring the glass.

examples.text: Nagdara tana kang mga prutas.
examples.translation: He brought some fruits.

examples.text: Gindara ko ang ayam ko paagto sa balay ka miga ko.
examples.translation: I brought my dog in the house of my girlfriend.

examples.text: Madara tana kang irimnun kar-on.
examples.translation: He will bring some drinks later.

examples.text: Kon amu ra nga magadara kang kalipay, batunon ko.
examples.translation: If that thing will bring happiness, I will accept it.

definitions.definition: anything that a person has with them when moving to a given location

examples.text: Lantawa to ang dara ni mama mo.
examples.translation: Check the things your mother brings.

definitions.definition: the number that comes after one and comes before three;

examples.text: Maagto kita darwa sa anda lugar.
examples.translation: The two of us will go to their place.

definitions.definition: being able to move, happen, or perform with more speed than normal;

examples.text: Dasig tana magdalagan.
examples.translation: He run so fast.

examples.text: Dasig-dasig ang sarakyan.
examples.translation: The vehicle is very fast.

definitions.definition: the swiftness of an object or a person

examples.text: Ang kadasigun kang sarakyan nagadepende sa drayber.
examples.translation: The swiftness of the vehicle depends on the driver.

definitions.definition: referring to the location a given object, person, event, or action can be found

examples.text: Diin ang tuwalya ko?
examples.translation: Where is my towel?

examples.text: Taga-diin kaw?
examples.translation: Where are you from?

definitions.definition: to reduce to powder or pulp by beating

examples.text: Nagadikdik kang panakut si nanay.
examples.translation: Mother is pounding the spices.

examples.text: Ginadikdik na ang ahos.
examples.translation: She is pounding the garlic.

examples.text: Nagdikdik si lola kang luy-a.
examples.translation: Grandma pounded ginger.

examples.text: Gindikdik na ang mga panakut.
examples.translation: She had pounded the spicies.

examples.text: Madikdik pa ako kang sibuyas.
examples.translation: I will pound onion.

examples.text: Dikdikin ko ang lunga.
examples.translation: I will have to pound the sesame seeds.

examples.text: Dikdikan ko kang luy-a ang almires
examples.translation: I will pound the ginger in small stone mortar.

definitions.definition: to stick out usually of one's tongue

examples.text: Hindi mag sagi ka padiwal.
examples.translation: Stop sticking out your tongue.

examples.text: Ginapadiwalan ka bata ang ana migo.
examples.translation: The kid is sticking out his tongue to his friend.

definitions.definition: the front part of the upper body that stretches between the neck and the stomach

examples.text: Gasakit dughan ko.
examples.translation: I have a chest pain.

examples.text: Ang dughanan nga tawo nagsulod sa Gym.
examples.translation: A barrel-chested man entered the gym.

definitions.definition: the red fluid that travels around the body and delivers substances to the organs

examples.text: Gusto ni Jun magtugro kang ana nga dugo.
examples.translation: Jun wants to donate his blood.

examples.text: Gindugo si Mercy. Nahulugan tana bata.
examples.translation: Mercy bled. She had a miscarriage.

examples.text: Nay, nagadugo ang pilas ni Rey.
examples.translation: Mom! Rey's wound is bleeding.

examples.text: Tawag kaw sa emergency. Ginadugo si Mercy. Daw mahulugan tana bata.
examples.translation: Call the emergency hotline. Mercy is bleeding. She is having a miscarriage.

examples.text: Padugu-I kang dugo kang pato ang bag-o nga sarakyan para maparayu sa disgrasya.
examples.translation: Put blood of duck on your new car to keep it away from accidents.

examples.text: Padugu-a ang kagat kang ayam sa lima mo.
examples.translation: Press the bite of the dog in your hand to bring out the blood.

examples.text: Antis magpatindog kang balay, paduguan ta anay ang lupa kang dugo kang manok.
examples.translation: Before we build house, we put chicken blood on the land.

examples.text: Duguon ang tawo nga nadasma sa tamburong.
examples.translation: The person who stumbled over a sink hole is bloody.

definitions.definition: having little or no light to see things clearly with

examples.text: Tama ka dulom ang akun nga kwarto.
examples.translation: My room is too dark.

examples.text: Kang nagsulod ako sa kweba, pirte ka dulum-dulum.
examples.translation: When I entered the cave, it was very dark.

examples.text: Nagdulom ang langit tungod sa damul nga gal-um.
examples.translation: The sky darkened because of thick clouds.

examples.text: Nagpadulum-dulum kami uli ka gab-i.
examples.translation: We went home late last night.

examples.text: Naga nga nagapadulom kamo diyan sa likod balay?
examples.translation: Why are you guys staying in the dark place at the back of our house?

examples.text: Nagadulom panuruk ko.
examples.translation: My eyesight is getting dark.

examples.text: Mapadulum-dulum lang ta uli.
examples.translation: Let's  go home late at night.

examples.text: Magdulom kar-on, uli kamo dayon.
examples.translation: If it gets dark later, come home immediately.

examples.text: Uli dayun halin sa iskwelahan. Indi magpadulom.
examples.translation: Go home immediately after school. Do not stay late outside.

definitions.definition: to have, form, and decide on an idea in one's mind

examples.text: Indi ako pag-istorboha kay nagapanumdum ako.
examples.translation: Do not disturb me because I am thinking.

examples.text: Ginadumdum ko tulad ang mga nagkaramatay ko ngaparyente.
examples.translation: I am remembering my departed loved ones today.

examples.text: Kaina, nanumdum ako kang mga baraklon ko.
examples.translation: Earlier, I was thinking about things to buy.

examples.text: Gindumdum ta ikaw sa kaadlawan mo.
examples.translation: I remembered you during your birthday.

examples.text: Kabay pa nga magadumdum ikaw kanakun.
examples.translation: May you remember me.

examples.text: Rum-an kaw run mapanaw sa Manila? Dumdumun mo kami nga mga barkada mo ha.
examples.translation: Are you leaving for Manila tomorrow? Please remember us your friends.

examples.text: Ginpanumduman ko man anay ang desisyon ko nga mag-sulod sa politika.
examples.translation: I studied my decision to enter politics.

examples.text: Panumduma anay ang sabat mo sa pamangkot.
examples.translation: Recall your answer to the question.

examples.text: Ano ang panumduman nanda kanakun, mango ako?
examples.translation: What were they thinking of me, I am stupid?

definitions.definition: food having grown foul, smells bad, and is no longer good to eat

examples.text: Tam-an ka baho ang dunot nga kapayas.
examples.translation: The rotten papaya smells so bad.

examples.text: Nadunot ang saging sa basurahan.
examples.translation: The banana rotted inside the trashbin.

examples.text: Naga-dunot ang saging?
examples.translation: Does banana rot?

examples.text: Paggwa-a sa plastic ang saging para indi madunot.
examples.translation: Take the banana out of the plastic so it will not rot.

definitions.definition: something or an object is flattened after being rolled over or pressed or stepped by a heavier object

examples.text: Gindunot kang 4-wheeler truck ang kuti.
examples.translation: A four-wheeler truck stepped on the cat.

examples.text: Nadunot gid ang saging nga napungkuan ko.
examples.translation: The banana was flattened after I unknowingly sat on it.

examples.text: Mag-obra guinamos, ginadunot ang hipon gamit ang kahig.
examples.translation: In making shrimp paste, a person is stepping, pressing the shrimps using his or her feet.

examples.text: Indi pagpungkui ang saging kay madunot.
examples.translation: Do not sit on the banana or it will be flattened

examples.text: Dunuta guid ang saging. Katiraw kaw kang bakol kar-on.
examples.translation: I'll hit you if you press the bananas.

examples.text: Hambal ni mama, dunuton kuno ang saging para gamitun sa pagraha kang banana cake.
examples.translation: Mom said to press the bananas which she will use in baking banana cake.

definitions.definition: an amount of saliva or phlegm that had come out from someone's mouth

examples.text: May dupra sa lababo.
examples.translation: There is spit in the sink.

examples.text: Ang sulod balay hindi ti durupra-an. Palihug sa sagwa kamo panupra.
examples.translation: Our house is not a place where you can spit everywhere. Please do it outside.

examples.text: Asta kadya, nagadupra gihapon si Totong.
examples.translation: Until now, Totong is still spitting.

examples.text: Ma'am, si Santi nagapanupra kanamun.
examples.translation: Ma'am, Santi is spitting at us.

examples.text: Ginadupra na ang plema.
examples.translation: He is spiiting the phlegm.

examples.text: Tana ang nagdupra kanakun.
examples.translation: He was the one who spit at me.

examples.text: Gindupra na ang pan-os nga kan-un.
examples.translation: He spit out the spoiled rice.

examples.text: I-dupra ang ginkaun mo, may hilo to.
examples.translation: Spit out the food that you ate, it has poison.

examples.text: Hindi pag dupra-i ang karsada/
examples.translation: Don’t spit on the road.

examples.text: Testingi niyo magpanupra sulod balay kay katiraw kamo kanakun.
examples.translation: Try spit inside our house and you will be punished.

definitions.definition: amounting to a large number of objects or persons;

examples.text: Duro nga mga estudyante ang nakapasar sa exam.
examples.translation: There are lots of students who passed the exam.

examples.text: Duro-duro ang bisita sa anda kasal.
examples.translation: They have lots of visitors in their wedding.

definitions.definition: to push and squeeze firmly against something
a word used to refer to something near the speaker and far away from the listener/s

examples.text: Amo dya ang akun kulintas.
examples.translation: This is my necklace.

definitions.definition: a word used to refer to somewhere near the listener and far away from the speaker

examples.text: May kuti dyan sa babaw ka lamesa?
examples.translation: Is there a cat on the table?

definitions.definition: the period of time between sunset and sunrise;

examples.text: Naga-ubra tana kung gabii.
examples.translation: She works at night.

definitions.definition: amounting to a small number of objects or persons;

examples.text: Gamay lang ang makaintindi kang akun nga sitwasyon.
examples.translation: Only few can understand my situation.

examples.text: Gamay-gamay lang ang tumalambong.
examples.translation: There are very few attendees.

definitions.definition: having less size than normal

examples.text: Naga istar tana sa gamay nga balay.
examples.translation: She live in a small house.

definitions.definition: the thick, white fluid produced by cows and goats that can be drank and be used to make other dairy products

examples.text: Na-ula ang gatas.
examples.translation: The milk spillled.

examples.text: Hambal ni tatay, gatasan mo ang baka.
examples.translation: Father said that you have to milk the cow.

examples.text: Ginagatasan ni Ben ang baka.
examples.translation: Ben is milking the cow.

examples.text: Gingatasan na ang  baka.
examples.translation: She has milked the cow.

definitions.definition: an opening to another area that can be entered by moving a movable barrier; a barrier that can be opened and closed, where people would normally pass before entering buildings, houses.

examples.text: Inyo to ang balay nga pula ang gawang?
examples.translation: Is your house the one with a red door?

definitions.definition: to take in and to let out air from the lungs

examples.text: Ginhawa ti dalum.
examples.translation: Breath deep.

examples.text: Nag-ginhawa si manang ti dalum antis mag-saot.
examples.translation: My elder sister took a deep breath before dancing.

examples.text: Naga-ginhawa ti dalum ang pasyente.
examples.translation: The patient is breathing deep.

examples.text: Maginhawa kaw ti dalum antis magkanta.
examples.translation: You take a deep breath before you sing.

definitions.definition: To make things done in rush as if to lose breath, usually in catching up for something like a deadline

examples.text: Ginhawa ko lang ra ka tapos ang project tapos indi man lang pagbatunon ni sir.
examples.translation: I rushed to finish my project but sir did not accept my submission.

definitions.definition: the supreme spiritual believed in and worshipped in a given religion

examples.text: Wara tana gapati sa Ginoo.
examples.translation: He does not believe in God.

definitions.definition: a large, organized, and armed fight between groups, organizations, or countries

examples.text: May gira kang darwa ka pamilya sa piyak nga banwa.
examples.translation: There is a war between two families in the next town.

examples.text: Indi sagi ka sunlog ang bugto mo, magira naman kar-on.
examples.translation: Do not bully your sibling or it will be another war later.

examples.text: Gin-sakit kaw nanda? Girahun ta sanda.
examples.translation: Did they hurt you? Let us start a war against them.

examples.text: Nagagirahay ang darwa ka pungsod.
examples.translation: The nations are at war with each other.

examples.text: Kapahon, nag-girahay ang mga komunista kag pulis sa pihak baryo.
examples.translation: Yesterday, the communists and policemen fought in a war in the neighboring barrio.

definitions.definition: females the sex organ found on the lower body between the base of the legs, in front of the buttocks, and extends to the uterus inside the body

examples.text: Ka gamay ka shorts nga suksuk mo. Kitaun giti mo.
examples.translation: The shorts you are wearing is skimpy. We are seeing your vagina.

definitions.definition: an expression that is used to describe a woman who shows excessive pride over herself

examples.text: Daw sa giti kaw.
examples.translation: You are like a vagina.

definitions.definition: to destroy a building and removing it completely

examples.text: Nagaguba si Omon kang tangkal rapit sa sapa.
examples.translation: Omon demolishes a pigpen near the stream.

examples.text: Ginaguba kang panday ang harigi.
examples.translation: The carpenter is demolishing the pillar.

examples.text: Nagguba si Patoy kang kamalig ni Paday.
examples.translation: Patoy demolished the hut of Paday.

examples.text: Ginguba na ang tangkal kang baboy.
examples.translation: He had demolished the pigpen.

examples.text: Mangguba si Derik kang mga pader.
examples.translation: Derik will demolish walls.

examples.text: Gub-un natun ang kudal nga harang.
examples.translation: Let's destroy the fence that hinders.

examples.text: Guba ang amun opsina.
examples.translation: Pur office is demolished,

examples.text: Dara ko ang pangguba sa pader.
examples.translation: I brought the thing to destroy the wall.

examples.text: Indi ko mabaton ang pagguba nanda kang balay.
examples.translation: I could not accept their demolition of the house.

definitions.definition: a plant with a long, slender stem that creeps along the ground, climbs on walls, or wraps around objects as it grows

examples.text: Nami ang gugo sa buhok.
examples.translation: The woody tendril-bearing wine is good for the hair.

examples.text: May nakasulod nga sapat sa balay.
examples.translation: An animal entered our house.

definitions.definition: one of the curved bones that, as a set, frames the chest and protects the internal organs found in it

examples.text: Nabari ang gusok ni Dan.
examples.translation: Dan broke his rib.

definitions.definition: the uncomfortable feeling of wanting and needing food

examples.text: May gutum sa lugar ta tungud sa baskug nga bagyo.
examples.translation: There is hunger in our town because of a strong typhoon.

examples.text: Tag-gurutum ang Agosto.
examples.translation: August is the month of hunger.

examples.text: Nagpaggutum ikaw haw?
examples.translation: Why did you starve yourself?

examples.text: Gin-gutum ako ka panaw ta.
examples.translation: Our walk made me feel hungry.

examples.text: Magutum ikaw kar-on kay wara ikaw ka pamahaw.
examples.translation: You will starve yourself  because you have not eaten your breakfast.

examples.text: Nagapagutum kaw haw?
examples.translation: Why do you starve yourself?

examples.text: Palihog, indi magpagutum.
examples.translation: PLease, do not starve yourself.

examples.text: Indi mo diya pagdarhun ang pagkaon? Mapagutum kaw?
examples.translation: Aren't you bringing this food? Are you going to starve your self?

examples.text: Ginpagutuman ako ni tito kagab-i.
examples.translation: Uncle starved me last night.

examples.text: Ginapagutuman ako ni tito.
examples.translation: Uncle is starving me.

examples.text: Gutum kamo run?
examples.translation: Are you guys hungry?

examples.text: Gutum-gutum guid ako ba kay wara ko kakaun pamahaw.
examples.translation: I am very hungry because I have not eaten my breakfast.

examples.text: Nagutum ako.
examples.translation: I am hungry.

examples.text: Gina-gutum ako ka malawid nga panaw ta.
examples.translation: Our long walk is starving me.

definitions.definition: to move from the inside of a given place to the outside

examples.text: Guwa to!
examples.translation: Go out!

examples.text: Nagguwa si Rita sa kwarto.
examples.translation: Rita went out of the room.

examples.text: Nagaguwa tana sa balay.
examples.translation: She is going out of the house

examples.text: Maguwa kami.
examples.translation: We will go out.

examples.text: Ipaggwa ang lechon baboy.
examples.translation: Bring out the roasted pig.

examples.text: Paggwa-a ang kwarta mo.
examples.translation: Show your money.

examples.text: Paggwa-on ko anay ang mga ayam sagwa balay.
examples.translation: I'll take out my dogs outside our house.

definitions.definition: having great beauty and is pleasing to one's senses

examples.text: Gwapa ang subang na nga bata.
examples.translation: Her eldest daughter is beautiful

examples.text: Gwapa-gwapa bata ni Elsa.
examples.translation: Elsa's daughter is very beautiful.

examples.text: Naggwapa ikaw.
examples.translation: You've become beautiful.

examples.text: Ano nga pampagwapa dara mo?
examples.translation: What make-up have you brought?

examples.text: Ginpagwapa niyo guid si Maria ba.
examples.translation: You really made Maria very beautiful.

examples.text: Nagpagwapa guid si nanay sa date nanda ni tatay.
examples.translation: My mother beautified herself for a date with my father.

examples.text: Nugay ka paggwapa.
examples.translation: Stop adorning yourself to look beautiful.

examples.text: Matahum gihapon ang ana lola.
examples.translation: Her grandmother is still beautiful.

examples.text: Nagagwapa ikaw kung nagangirit pirme.
examples.translation: You become beautiful if you always smile.

examples.text: Nagapagwapa pa si Melissa sa sulod banyo.
examples.translation: Melissa is beautifying herself inside the comfort room.

examples.text: Maabat lang kami sa birthday. Pagwapahun ko pa si Maria antis kami mag-agto.
examples.translation: We will just catch up with you guys. I will just make Maria look more beautiful before we go to the birthday party.

examples.text: Patiha ako, pagwapahun ta ikaw.
examples.translation: Trust me. I will make you beautiful.

examples.text: Ma-late kami sa party. Ginapagwaphan ko pa si Maria antis mag-agto diyan.
examples.translation: We will be late to the party. I am still putting makeup on Maria before going there.

definitions.definition: a strong wind that blows from the south and west that brings, hot, humid, and rainy weather

examples.text: Ang habagat ang nagapabaskug kang uran nga naga resulta kang pagbaha sa suba.
examples.translation: Southwest moonsoon brings heavy rainfall that causes water to overflow in river.

definitions.definition: a sharp object not being sharp or pointed anymore to cut properly

examples.text: Habol ang kutsilyo.
examples.translation: The knife is dull.

examples.text: Naghabol ang kutsilyo sa tinuig nga wara gingamit.
examples.translation: The knife lost its sharpness because it was unused for years.

examples.text: Nagahabol ang kutsilyo kung wara ginalimpyohan tapos gamiton.
examples.translation: The knife is losing its sharpness if left unwashed after use.

examples.text: Mahabol ang kutsilyo kung wara ginagamit.
examples.translation: The knife will lose its sharpness if not used.

definitions.definition: to form cloth or fabric by repeatedly crossing threads or strips over and under each other

examples.text: Ang pagbahul sangka tradisyon-kultural nga dapat ipadayon.
examples.translation: Weaving is a cultural tradition that needs to be sustained.

examples.text: Nagahabul kang barong si Leklek.
examples.translation: Leklek weaves a barong.

examples.text: Ginahabul na ang panyo nga garamitun sa saot.
examples.translation: She is weaving the handkerchief to be used in the dance.

examples.text: Naghabul si lola kang para sa apo na.
examples.translation: Grandmother weaved for her grandchild.

examples.text: Ginhabul na ang panyo nga gingamit ko.
examples.translation: She weaved the handkerchief that I used.

examples.text: Mahabul kita para may kwarta.
examples.translation: Let us weave so that we have money.

examples.text: Kinanglan mo hablun ang seda nga ran.
examples.translation: You need to weave that silk.

examples.text: Utda kag ihabul sanda nga darwa.
examples.translation: Cut and weave them together.

definitions.definition: the feeling of worry by assuming or being aware of danger

examples.text: Indi gihapon madura nang akon kahadluk.
examples.translation: My fear is not easily gone.

examples.text: Hadluka bala tana para mag-untat.
examples.translation: Scare him so that he will stop.

examples.text: Ginapahadlukan mo ang bata.
examples.translation: You are scaring the child.

examples.text: Ginpahadlukan ko tana para indi kauli.
examples.translation: I scared him so that he won't go home.

definitions.definition: a series of steps that connects one floor of a building to another

examples.text: Kataas-taas kang hagdan niyo ba.
examples.translation: Your stairs are very high.

examples.text: Ginhagdan ko lang pakadto dya sa iskwelahan.
examples.translation: I used stairs on my way to school

examples.text: Nag-hagdan lang kami pakadto sa iskwelahan.
examples.translation: We used the stairs on our way to school.

examples.text: Kada-adlaw, ginahagdan ko lang magkadto diya sa iskwelahan halin sa balay.
examples.translation: I am using the stairs on my way to school from our house every day.

examples.text: Mahagdan lang daw sanda pauli.
examples.translation: They will use the stairs on their way home.

definitions.definition: not fitting closely to the body

examples.text: Gusto ko ang mga halog nga bayo.
examples.translation: I like loose clothes

definitions.definition: being free from tight holds and can be removed more freely

examples.text: Halog-halog ang higot sa alima kang preso.
examples.translation: The tie on the hand of the prisoner is very loose.

definitions.definition: to use words to express ideas;

examples.text: Nagahambal si Diding parte sa ritwal.
examples.translation: Diding speaks about the ritual.

examples.text: Ti, ginahambal mo nga malain tana nga tawo?
examples.translation: So, are you saying that he is a bad person?

examples.text: Naghambal si Kame sa pulong-pulong.
examples.translation: Kame spoke at the meeting.

examples.text: Wara tana ti ginhambal nahanungod sa sitwasyon.
examples.translation: He said nothing about the situation.

examples.text: Mahambal man ang tawo nga ran, indi lang pagpirita.
examples.translation: That person will speak, just don't force her.

examples.text: Wara ako ti hambalon sa imo.
examples.translation: I don't have anything to say to you..

examples.text: Kay-ada ang paghambal.
examples.translation: Be mindful of the way you speak.

definitions.definition: to use one's voice to exchange words with other people

examples.text: Nagahambal pa tana.
examples.translation: She's still speaking.

examples.text: Ginhambalan na ako nahanungod sa isyu.
examples.translation: She spoke to me about the issue.

examples.text: Ginsugtan namun tana nga maghambal sa tubang.
examples.translation: We allowed her to speak in front.

examples.text: Magahambal ang presidente sa palasyo sa rum-an.
examples.translation: The president will speak at the palace tomorrow.

definitions.definition: having a sweet, pleasant, and comforting smell

examples.text: Hamot ana dapug.
examples.translation: Her fragrant smells so good.

examples.text: Nagpahamot guid si manong kay kitaon na miga na.
examples.translation: My older brother put some pleasant grances over himself because he will meet his girlfriend.

examples.text: Nagapahamot pa si manang. Hulat kaw lang daw anay.
examples.translation: My older sister is still putting some pleasant fragrances over herself. Just wait for her.

examples.text: Hulat lang guid. Mapahamot ko anay.
examples.translation: Wait a minute. I will put some pleasant frangrances over myself.

definitions.definition: to hit something or someone, more often using an object that one's hands, and making a loud noise

examples.text: Nagahampak ang balud sa bibi.
examples.translation: The waves are striking the shore.

examples.text: Ginahampak na ang sapat gamit ang lubid.
examples.translation: He is striking his animal using a rope.

examples.text: Ang bata ang naghampak kanakun.
examples.translation: It was the child that struck me.

examples.text: Ginhampak na ako sa dahi.
examples.translation: She struck him on the forehead.

examples.text: Mahalin kaw diyan o ihampak ko diya kanimo?
examples.translation: Will you go away or I'll strike you with this?

examples.text: Hadluk ako nga hampakun na ako liwat.
examples.translation: I'm afraid that he will strike me again.

definitions.definition: the air that naturally moves across the sky and over the earth

examples.text: Limpyo ang akun nga kuko.
examples.translation: My nails are clean.

definitions.definition: a piece of jewelry made of beads linked together with long, thin thread and can worn around the neck

examples.text: Kanami guid bala kang imo nga mga kulintas.
examples.translation: Your necklaces are very beautiful.

examples.text: Nang-kulintas guid ti nami si Aira.
examples.translation: Aira wore a very beautiful necklace.

examples.text: Sa JS prom, mang-kulintas ako kang gabadlak nga kulintas.
examples.translation: On the day of our JS prom, I will wear a shining necklace.

examples.text: Kulintasi niyo ang reyna para mag-dugang ang gwapa.
examples.translation: Wear our queen with a necklace to make her more beautiful.

examples.text: Kulintasan ta ang imahe ni Santa Clara.
examples.translation: Let us put a necklace on Saint Claire.

examples.text: Gin-kulintasan tana kang bulawan kang ana nga migo.
examples.translation: Her boyfriend wore her a gold necklace.

examples.text: Natapos run ang pag-make-up kay Amy. Kurulintasan na guid lang.
examples.translation: Amy is done with her make-up. She will only need to wear a necklace.

definitions.definition: a small to medium-sized, hairy animal that has long ears, a big nouse, and wings of skin;

examples.text: Raku kurunaknit sa sulud ka kweba.
examples.translation: There are a plenty of bats inside the cave.

definitions.definition: having hair that grows in curls or in curves

examples.text: Kurung ang buhok ni April.
examples.translation: April's hair is curly.

examples.text: Kurung-kurung ang buhok na.
examples.translation: His hair is very curly.

examples.text: Tam-an ka niwang si Jm.
examples.translation: Jm is so thin.

examples.text: Ay abaw! Niwang-niwang gid tana kanimo!
examples.translation: Oh my! You are extremely thin!

examples.text: Nagapakurung si lola.
examples.translation: Grandmother is getting her hair curled.

examples.text: Kahapon nagpakurung akosa parlor.
examples.translation: Yesterday, I had my hair curled at the parlor.

examples.text: Ginkurong takun ni Alex.
examples.translation: Alex had curled my hair.

examples.text: Kinanglan ko mapakurung.
examples.translation: I need to have my hair curled.

examples.text: Indi magkabalaka, kurungun ko buhok mo.
examples.translation: Do not worry, I will curl your hair.

examples.text: Ginapakurung ni Mayumi ang ana buhok.
examples.translation: Mayumi is having her hair curled.

definitions.definition: the soft tissue made of fat and muscle that covers the organs and found between the skin and bones

examples.text: Raku ang kaon ko nga kusug kang baboy kahapon.
examples.translation: I ate a lot of pork meat yesterday.

examples.text: Nami ang unod ka karne, indi ti tig-a usapun.
examples.translation: I like the meat of cow, it is not hard to chew.

definitions.definition: a small, flat, six-legged insect that lives on animals or humans and feeds on their blood;

examples.text: Yak! May kuto kaw sa buhok.
examples.translation: Yuck! You have a louse in your hair.

examples.text: Kutuhan ta ikaw.
examples.translation: I will clear your head with lice.

examples.text: Lihog kutuhi ko bi.
examples.translation: Please, clear my head with lice.

examples.text: Ginakutuhan ni nanay na ang ana ulo.
examples.translation: Her mother is removing lice from her head.

examples.text: Ginkutuhan ako ni nanay ka-ina.
examples.translation: Mother cleared my head with lice.

examples.text: Hindi takun kanimo. Kutuhun kaw.
examples.translation: I do not like you. You have lice.

definitions.definition: an abnormal growth on a part of one's body, usually resulting from an injury

examples.text: May lagub kaw sa itsura mo.
examples.translation: There is something swelling on your face.

examples.text: Nag-lagub ang lima ko kagab-i.
examples.translation: Last night, my hand was swelled.

examples.text: Lantawa gin-obra mo sa kahig ko, naga-lagub.
examples.translation: Look at what you did to my leg, it is swelling.

examples.text: Ma-lagub ra kar-on ang lima mo nga nakabunggo sa ding-ding.
examples.translation: Your hand that knocked on the wall will swell later.

examples.text: Naga-lagub ang lima mo.
examples.translation: Your hand is swelling.

definitions.definition: an object, person having traits that is partly or completely not the same with another object or person

examples.text: Lain-lain kita kada sara.
examples.translation: We are different from each other.

examples.text: Naglain ang tsura mo.
examples.translation: Your face changed.

examples.text: Laina ang burutangan kang puti nga bayo kag decolor.
examples.translation: Separate the white clothes from colored clothes into different closets

examples.text: Nagalain ang color kang bayo kung maadlawan.
examples.translation: The color of the shirt changes when exposed to sunlight.

examples.text: Malain naman ko kang hampang.
examples.translation: I will change my game.

definitions.definition: a fully-grown male human being;

examples.text: Ikaw ang laki nga kinanglan ko sa akun kabuhi.
examples.translation: You are the man I need in my life.

definitions.definition: a tool made of long narrow threads loosely woven together, and is used for catching fish or other animals

examples.text: Pag-un ang lambat nga gin gamit sa pagpangisda.
examples.translation: The net used in fishing was heavy-duty.

examples.text: Gin-pahuy-an na ikaw sa tubang ka raku nga tawo? Lambati bala para madudla.
examples.translation: Did he humiliate you in front of a crowd? Assault him in surprise so he will learn his lesson.

examples.text: Lambatan ta niyo si Russel kay gin-pahuy-an na ako kaina sa tubang kang miga ko.
examples.translation: Later, we will assault Russel in surprise because he humiliated me earlier in front of my girlfriend.

examples.text: Gin-lambatan nanda ako ka gab-i sa dalan.
examples.translation: They assaulted me in surprise last night in the street.

definitions.definition: a very small, winged insect with six legs and a long sucking mouth-part that can suck blood from animals and humans;

examples.text: Nakasulud ang lamok sa moskitiro.
examples.translation: A mosquito entered the mosquito net.

examples.text: Sigurado ako nga malamokan gid ako samtang gahulat kay nanay.
examples.translation: I’m sure that i will be bitten by mosquitos while waiting for my mother.

examples.text: Ginalamokan ako diya ka hulat kanimo.
examples.translation: I am being bitten by mosquitoes while waiting for you.

examples.text: Ginlamokan ako ka hulat kanimo.
examples.translation: I was bitten by mosquitos waiting for you.

definitions.definition: to get infested by flies

examples.text: Patya ang lagong.
examples.translation: Kill the big fly.

examples.text: Takpi ang pagkaun para di pag langawan.
examples.translation: Cover our food so it will not be infested by flies.

examples.text: Ginalangawan ang tangkal kang baboy.
examples.translation: The pig's cage is being infested by flies.

examples.text: Ginlangawan ang pagkaun sa lamisa ta.
examples.translation: Our food on the table was infested by flies.

definitions.definition: the spiritual place believed to be in the sky above the earth where God and other spirits live in

examples.text: Gintuga kang Ginoo ang langit.
examples.translation: God created heaven.

examples.text: Daw langit ang nabatyagan ko.
examples.translation: I feel heaven.

examples.text: Nagpalangit ang kalag ni Rodel.
examples.translation: Rodel's soul went to heaven.

examples.text: Nagapalangit ang mga kalag kung pista minatay.
examples.translation: Souls are going to heaven during All Souls Day.

examples.text: Mapalangit ang tanan nga mga kalag.
examples.translation: All souls will go to heaven.

definitions.definition: to stay afloat and to move across a liquid surface

examples.text: Indi mag-untat langoy.
examples.translation: Do not stop swimming.

examples.text: Naglangoy tanda sa baybay.
examples.translation: They swam in the sea.

examples.text: Wara guid ti nagalangoy.
examples.translation: No one was swimming.

examples.text: Gusto ko maglangoy.
examples.translation: I want to swim.

examples.text: Malangoy ako sa rum-an
examples.translation: I will swim tomorrow.

examples.text: Languyun ko lang pakadto sa piyak isla.
examples.translation: I will just swim to go to the next island.

definitions.definition: to actively find something or someone by using one's eyes

examples.text: Nagalantaw sanda kang tv.
examples.translation: They are watching tv.

examples.text: Ginalantaw nanda ang pelikula.
examples.translation: The  movie is being watched  by them.

examples.text: Naglantaw ako kang sipal na.
examples.translation: I watched his game.

examples.text: Ginlantaw na ako nga gasaot.
examples.translation: He watched me as I danced.

examples.text: Malantaw ta kang movie sa sinehan kar-on.
examples.translation: We will watch a movie in the cinema later.

examples.text: Lantawun ta ang sipal ni Edward.
examples.translation: Let us watch Edward’s game.

examples.text: Lantawa bala ang mga bulak sa lamisa, kagamay-gamay.
examples.translation: Look at the flowers on the table, they are very small.

examples.text: Manuglantaw lang timo.
examples.translation: You are only a watcher.

examples.text: Turuk sa kisame, may suksuk.
examples.translation: Look at the ceiling, there is a lizard.

examples.text: Si Mercy paralantaw kang tv.
examples.translation: Mercy is fond of watching tv.

examples.text: Nagturuk si Anthony kanakun.
examples.translation: Anthony looked at me.

examples.text: Antis kaw maglaktud sa karsada, maturuk kaw anay sa wala kag tuo kung wara sarakyan.
examples.translation: Before you cross the street, you have to look at your left and right to check if there is no vehicle.

examples.text: Turuka bala ang kisame, may suksuk.
examples.translation: Look at the ceiling, there is a lizard.

examples.text: Antis kaw maglaktud sa karsada, turukun mo ang wala kag tuo mo kung wara ti sarakyan.
examples.translation: Before you cross the street, you have to look at your left and right to see if there is no vehicle.

definitions.definition: a soft, slimy, sticky mixture of earth and water

examples.text: Nalubong ang sarakyan ni Patrick sa lao.
examples.translation: Patrick's car was stuck in the mud.

examples.text: Malao ang aragyan sa kaniyogan.
examples.translation: The road to cocoland is muddy.

definitions.definition: having a greater width than normal

examples.text: Lapad katama ang dalan.
examples.translation: The road is so wide.

examples.text: Indi pagkaluta ang katul mo. Malapad ra kar-on.
examples.translation: Do not scratch your skin rashes or its redness will spread.

examples.text: Naglapad ang suba tungud sa baha.
examples.translation: The river widened because of flooding.

examples.text: Lapada ang balay mo.
examples.translation: Make your house look spacious.

examples.text: Ginpalapad ko ang plaza.
examples.translation: I ordered the widening of the plaza.

examples.text: Nagalapad ang suba.
examples.translation: The water in the river is expanding.

examples.text: Kung magsige-sige ang uran, malapad guid ang tubig sa suba kag malab-ot guid ka tubig ang balay ni Marites.
examples.translation: If the rain continues, the water in the river will widen and the the water will reach Marite's house.

examples.text: Kung magpatindug ako balay, lapadun ko ang sala.
examples.translation: If I build my house in the future, I will make my living room big.

definitions.definition: a small insect that has six legs and stinging jaws, and is part of a large colony of other ants;

examples.translation: The bread has ants.

examples.text: Takpi ang pagkaun sa lamisa. Lasgaan ra kar-on.
examples.translation: You cover the food on the table. The ants will eat them.

examples.text: Ginalasgaan ang tinapay.
examples.translation: The ants are eating the bread.

examples.text: Nalasgaan ang pagkaun sa lamisa.
examples.translation: The ants ate the food on the table.

definitions.definition: to have an idea about something; to understand; to know

examples.text: Latu ni Nene kung ano ang natabo kana kahapon.
examples.translation: Nene knows what happened to her yesterday.

examples.text: Ginlatu ko kung sin-o ang nagbuol ka akon lapis.
examples.translation: I made an action to know who took my pencil.

examples.text: Lat-an na man kung paano magraha ka puto.
examples.translation: He also knows how to cook puto.

examples.text: Nalat-an na nga ginloko tana manugbaligya.
examples.translation: He knew that the seller fooled him.

examples.text: May latu kaw kung diin ko ginbutang ang libro.
examples.translation: You have a knowledge as to where I put the book.

examples.text: Raku nalat-an ang bata sa mga sipal.
examples.translation: The kid has a lot of knowledge on games.

definitions.definition: a large body of water surrounded by land and not connected to the sea except by streams and rivers

examples.text: Dalum-dalum ang lawa.
examples.translation: The lake is very deep.

definitions.definition: the whole physical form of a living being and all of its working organs;

examples.text: Manami ang kurba kang ana nga lawas,
examples.translation: The curve of her/his body is beautiful.

definitions.definition: the watery liquid found in the mouth that helps make food more digestable

examples.translation: Her pillow is full of saliva.

examples.text: Naglaway ko dapug kang mangga.
examples.translation: I salivated when I smelled mangoes.

examples.text: Nay, ginlawayan ako ni Toto.
examples.translation: Mom, Toto spitted out his saliva on me.

examples.text: Nagalaway ko sa dapug kang mangga.
examples.translation: I salivate when I smell mangoes.

examples.text: Malaway kaw sa kanamit kang raha ko.
examples.translation: You will salivate when you taste my good food.

examples.text: Para-laway ang bata ni Ruby nga si Ren-Ren.
examples.translation: Ruby's daughter named Ren-Ren salivates a lot.

definitions.definition: a person who is in high authority;

examples.text: Tana ang lider namun.
examples.translation: She is our leader.

definitions.definition: the rear part of the upper body that stretches below the back of the neck down to the pelvis

examples.translation: My back hurts.

examples.text: Nagtalikod tana.
examples.translation: He turned his back.

examples.text: Matalikod kaw dapat!
examples.translation: You need to turn your back.

examples.text: Nagatalikod ang bata.
examples.translation: The child turns her back.

examples.text: Ginatalikudan ni Ami ang tawo nga nagahambal ka na.
examples.translation: Ami is turning her back on the person who is talking to her.

examples.text: Gintalikudan ko si nanay hay perti ka wakalan.
examples.translation: I turned my back on mother because she was chatty.

examples.text: Tana ran ang nakatalikod nga tawo.
examples.translation: That person who has his back turned is him.

definitions.definition: the number that comes after four and comes before six;

examples.text: Nagbakal ako kang lima ka mansanas.
examples.translation: I bought five apples.

definitions.definition: being free of dirt, stains, or diseases

examples.translation: As a teacher, I want a clean classroom.

examples.text: Ginpalimyuhan ko ang pungtod ni lola.
examples.translation: I asked someone to clean the grave of my grandmother.

examples.text: May higku bayo mo.
examples.translation: There is dirt on your shirt.

examples.text: Mang-limpyu kita kapiya kar-on.
examples.translation: Let us clean the chapel later.

examples.text: San-o kaw mapalimpyo kang kwarto mo?
examples.translation: When are you going to ask someone to clean your room?

examples.text: Ginlimpyuhan nanda ang kwarto.
examples.translation: They cleaned the room.

examples.text: Ginalimpyuhan na ang sarakyan.
examples.translation: She is cleaning her car.

examples.text: Indi anay kamo magsaka sa hagdan kay ginapalimyuhan ko pa.
examples.translation: Do not climb the stairs because someone is cleaning it.

definitions.definition: to remove dirt, stains, and other unwanted objects from an object or place

examples.translation: Let us clean.

examples.text: Imo nga limpyohan ang imo kwarto.
examples.translation: You have to clean your room.

examples.text: Nagapanglimpyo ang bilog nga pamilya kang balay.
examples.translation: The whole family cleans the house.

examples.text: Ginalimpyuhan na ang anang sarakyan.
examples.translation: She is cleaning her car.

examples.text: Ang nanay naglimpyo kang kwarto
examples.translation: The mother cleaned the room.

examples.text: Ginlimpyuhan nanda ang bintana kahapon.
examples.translation: They cleaned the windows yesterday.

examples.text: Malimpyo ang pinggan.
examples.translation: The plate is clean.

definitions.definition: the sound made by a living being's lungs and throat, and is spoken through the mouth and lips;

examples.text: Manami ang limug ni Karen.
examples.translation: Karen's voice is beautiful.

definitions.definition: a long, thin piece of wood that can be held in one's hand

examples.text: Lipak ang ginagamit ni tatay kung ginabal-bal na ako kada may sala ako.
examples.translation: My father uses stick to physically punish me every time I do wrong.

definitions.definition: being unable to remember or losing memories of something from the past

examples.text: Mal-am run guid si lola, marilipatun run.
examples.translation: My grandmother is very old, she is now forgetful.

definitions.definition: a visual shot of a given object, place, or a person; a product of photography

examples.text: Kagwapa kanimo sa litrato nga diya.
examples.translation: You are beautiful in this picture.

examples.text: Diin run manog-litratu ta?
examples.translation: Where is our cameraman?

examples.text: Gin-tungtung ko ang kodak sa babaw aparador.
examples.translation: I put the picture on top of the cabinet.

examples.text: Litratuhi ako danay sa tubang simbahan.
examples.translation: Take me a picture in front of the church.

examples.text: Litratuhan mo ako sa tubang munisipyo kar-on.
examples.translation: You will take me a picture in front of the municipal hall later.

examples.text: Gin-litratuhan ako ni manang.
examples.translation: My elder sister took me a picture.

examples.text: Ngirit! Ginalitratuhan kita kang mga tawo.
examples.translation: Smile! People are taking photos of us.

definitions.definition: the narrow part of the upper body that connects the head to the shoulders

examples.text: Labug ang liug ni Joel.
examples.translation: Joey has a long neck.

definitions.definition: to put something deep in the ground and covering it with earth;

examples.text: Nagalubung si Amel kang ayam.
examples.translation: Amel is burying a dog.

examples.text: Ginalubung ni Teng ang napatay nga ayam.
examples.translation: Teng is burying the dead dog.

examples.text: Naglubung si Jojo kang ana alaga.
examples.translation: Jojo buried his pet.

examples.text: Ginlubung tana sa Antique.
examples.translation: He was buried in Antique.

examples.text: Malubung pa ako kang amun karbaw.
examples.translation: I will have to bury our carabao.

examples.text: Ilubung ko ang napatay ko nga ayam.
examples.translation: I will bury my dead dog.

examples.text: Lubngi kang luy-a ang lugar nga ria.
examples.translation: Bury a  ginger in that area.

examples.text: Malinung ang rulubngan.
examples.translation: The burial place is peaceful.

definitions.definition: the rear part of the neck

examples.text: Gin-harukan ang akun lubut.
examples.translation: He kissed my nape.

definitions.definition: to move below a liquid surface and much further down

examples.text: Naglugdang ang barko kahapon.
examples.translation: The boat sunk yesterday.

examples.text: Nagalugdang ang barko sa dagat.
examples.translation: The ship is sinking in the ocean.

examples.text: Malugdang run ang barko.
examples.translation: The ship is about to sink.

definitions.definition: the salty, watery liquid that comes out from the eyes to moisten the organ

examples.text: Nakita ko ang mga luha sa mata ni nanay.
examples.translation: I saw tears in my mother's eyes.

definitions.definition: a small or medium-sized, soft-bodied sea animal with six short arms, two longer arms, and two fins at the top of its pointed head;

examples.text: Garagmay ang lucos sa tinda.
examples.translation: The squids in the market are very small.

definitions.definition: a superstitious charm that is used for making another person fall in love with the owner

examples.text: Gamiti kang lumay ang nobyo mo para magdugang luyag na kanimo.
examples.translation: Use love potion to your boyfriend so that he will love you more.

examples.text: Si Tatay ang pinaka-kilala nga manog-lumay kang banwa natun.
examples.translation: My father is the most famous in doing love spell in our town.

examples.text: Gina-lumay mo ako no?
examples.translation: Are you using love spell on me?

examples.text: Kang nagligad nga tuig, gin-lumay ako ni Maria.
examples.translation: Last year, Maria used a love spell on me.

examples.text: Lumayun ko si Jun-jun para maluyag tana kanakun.
examples.translation: I will use a love spell to Jun-Jun so he will love me more.

examples.text: Indi kaw magparapit kay Rita. She is doing love spell to make people love her.
examples.translation: Do not go near Rita because she is using love spell.

definitions.definition: the flat, green part of plants that changes or loses its color when seasons change or when the plant withers

examples.text: Raku lumot sa sapa.
examples.translation: There are plenty of moss in the creek.

examples.text: Lumuton ang suba.
examples.translation: The river is mossy.

definitions.definition: a person or an animal who pushes itself off the surface and into the air, the legs and the feet are raised off the ground

examples.text: Nakakita ako kang nagalumpat nga pangka.
examples.translation: I saw a jumping frog.

definitions.definition: to die by sinking under water and losing one's breath

examples.text: Kaun anay kamo antis magpanaw.
examples.translation: Eat before you leave.

examples.text: Ginalumus ni Alex ang kontra na.
examples.translation: Alex is drowning his enemy.

examples.text: Nalumus ang tawo sa suba tungud sa baskug nga baha.
examples.translation: The person got drowned in the river due to violent flooding.

examples.text: Ginlumos ni Erik ang kontra na sa dalum nga bubon.
examples.translation: Erik drowned his enemy in a deep well.

examples.text: Indi maglangoy sa dalum kun indi mo gusto malumus.
examples.translation: Do not swim in deep water if you don’t want to drown yourself.

examples.text: Palumsan ko bala si Jay.
examples.translation: I will drown Jay.

examples.text: Ginapalumsan ni Bokyo ang ayam.
examples.translation: Bokyo drowns the dog.

definitions.definition: the thick, dark material covering the upper layer of the Earth;

examples.text: Mara ang lupa.
examples.translation: The soil is dry.

definitions.definition: to move across the air without touching the ground until landing

examples.text: Naglupad ang eroplano sa babaw namun.
examples.translation: A plane flew above us.

examples.text: Nagalupad ang mga pispis.
examples.translation: The birds are flying.

examples.text: Kon may gahum ako, malupad ako paagto dyan.
examples.translation: If I have powers, I will fly going there.

examples.text: Nagpalupad sanda kahapon kang burador sa binit suba.
examples.translation: They flew a kite yesterday beside the river.

examples.text: Ginpalupad ni tito ang burador.
examples.translation: My uncle made the kite fly.

examples.text: Nagapalupad sanda kang burador.
examples.translation: They are flying a kite.

examples.text: Ang eroplano ginapalupad kang mga piloto.
examples.translation: Pilots make airplanes fly.

examples.text: Palupada ang burador.
examples.translation: Fly the kite.

examples.text: Palupadun mo run kadya ang borador.
examples.translation: You need to fly the kite now.

definitions.definition: staying on and being carried along a liquid surface or staying afloat in the air

examples.translation: The leaves floated on the water.

examples.text: Nagalutaw ang mga plastic sa suba.
examples.translation: Plastics are floating in the river.

examples.text: Saktuhan ang tubig para maglutaw ang baroto..
examples.translation: There is enough water for the ship to float.

examples.text: Kinanglan mo palutawon ang habon para mapati ako.
examples.translation: You should make the soap float for me to believe.

definitions.definition: the strong-smelling root of the ginger plant that is used as spices, flavourings, and medicine

examples.text: Isampaw ko ang luy-a sa isda?
examples.translation: Shall I add ginger into the fish?

examples.text: Darha ang gamasakit mo nga bata sa manug luy-a
examples.translation: Bring your sick child to a traditional healer in the barrio who uses ginger as cure.

definitions.definition: having little strength, energy, or power

examples.text: Nagluya ang anang lawas halin kahapon.
examples.translation: Her body became so weak since yesterday.

examples.text: Indi ko run kaya ang akon kaluyahun.
examples.translation: I could not bear my weakness anymore.

examples.text: Ginapaluya mo ako sa ubra mo nga ria.
examples.translation: You are making me weak because of what you are doing.

examples.text: Nagpaluya abi ikaw amu nga perdi ikaw.
examples.translation: You made yourself weak that's why you lost.

examples.text: Andut ginpaluya mo mong kaugalingon?
examples.translation: Why did you make yourself weak?

examples.text: Indi gid ikaw magpaluya!
examples.translation: Never make yourself weak!

examples.text: Nagapaluya si Jean
examples.translation: Jean is making herself weak.

examples.text: Paluyahun mo takun hay?
examples.translation: You will be making me weak?

definitions.definition: having little or no power, force, or energy

examples.text: Luya si nanay.
examples.translation: My moter is weak.

examples.text: Nangluya ang tuhod ko.
examples.translation: My knees weakened.

examples.text: Nagaluya ang tawo kung wara gakaun.
examples.translation: A person becomes weak if he or she does not eat.

examples.text: Kaun ti raku. Mangluya kaw kar-on.
examples.translation: Eat plenty or you will weaken.

definitions.definition: having less weight that makes something or someone easier to carry or move

examples.translation: She needs light amount work.

examples.text: Mag-an-mag-an ang dara ko.

examples.translation: The branch of the mango tree broke and fell off.

examples.text: Gasanga-sanga run ang mga problema ko.
examples.translation: My problems are multiplying.

definitions.definition: the number that comes after ninety-nine and comes before one hundred and one

examples.text: Kon makita mo ang numero nga sanggatos sa libro, may padya ikaw.
examples.translation: If you found the number one hundred in the book, you will have a prize.

examples.text: Sanggatos ang akun sensilyo.
examples.translation: My change is one hundred pesos.

examples.text: Ginatos ang bisita sa kasal nanday Tarithi kag Tampuhaw.
examples.translation: The wedding of Tarithi and Tampuhaw has hundreds of guests.

definitions.definition: the number that comes after nine hundred ninety-nine and comes before one thousand and one

examples.translation: There are three zeroes in one thousand.

examples.text: Sanglibo ang amun aramutan sa Christmas party.
examples.translation: Our contribution in the Christmas party is worth one thousand pesos.

examples.text: Linibo ang tagpasakup nga nakita ko sa listahan.
examples.translation: I saw thousands of contestants in the list.

definitions.definition: referring to the time that an event or action can, will, or had happened

examples.text: San-o kaw masaylo balay?
examples.translation: When will you transfer house?

examples.text: Kasan-o kaw nagsaylo balay?
examples.translation: When did you transfer house?

definitions.definition: person, animal to move one's body to the rhythm of music or to one's emotions

examples.text: Nagasaot sanda kang Binanog.
examples.translation: They dance Binanog.

examples.text: Ginasaot kang mga kabataan ang Tinikling.
examples.translation: The children are dancing the Tinikling.

examples.translation: She danced at the feast.

examples.text: Ginsaot namun ang ginpraktisan sa balay.
examples.translation: We danced what we had practiced at our house.

examples.text: Masaot kami .
examples.translation: We will dance .

examples.text: Isaot lang ang kasubo mo asta madura.
examples.translation: Just dance your sorrows until they are gone.

examples.text: Saoton natun ang Kuratsa.
examples.translation: We will dance the Kuratsa.

examples.text: Wara ako kang naman-an nga saot.
examples.translation: I don't know any dance.

examples.text: Kanami kang pagsaot kang bata.
examples.translation: The child's dancing is graceful.

examples.text: Sagad nga manugsaot si Francis.
examples.translation: Francis is a skilled dancer.

definitions.definition: a living thing that is born, grows, feeds, reacts, and makes bodily wastes; and has a working body with limbs and sensory organs;

examples.text: May nakasulod nga sapat sa balay.

examples.text: Duro ang anda kasapatan.
examples.translation: They have many animals.

definitions.definition: a long, scaly animal with no legs and can have fangs with venom;

examples.text: Nakagat ako kang sawa.
examples.translation: I was bitten by a snake.

definitions.definition: any of the thin, sharp, pointy parts of a fish skeleton

examples.translation: I accidentally swallowed a fish bone. It hurts.

examples.text: Aguy! Nasikagan ako.
examples.translation: Ouch! A fish bone is stuck in my throat.

definitions.definition: any of the thin, sharp, pointy parts of a fish skeleton

examples.text: Raku sikag kang bangrus.
examples.translation: Milkfish has plenty of fishbones.

examples.text: Sa kakaun ko kang bangrus, nasikagan ako.
examples.translation: Because I ate many milkfish, a fishbone stuck in my throat.

definitions.definition: the part of the arm that bends at the joint

examples.translation: My elbow is aching.

examples.text: Mangsiko ako kananda para lang makabalos.
examples.translation: I will elbow them just to get even.

examples.text: Sikuhon ta lang kawkar-on kung gapadulong run tana.
examples.translation: I will elbow you later when he is coming.

examples.text: Wara ako kapugong, nagpangsiko ako kananda.

examples.text: Ginpangsiko sanda ni Mary hay mga gahud.
examples.translation: Mary elbowed them because they were noisy.

examples.text: Nagapangsiko kang mga kontra na ang bata ni Loling
examples.translation: Loling’s child elbows her opponents!

examples.text: Ginapangsiko na ana mg akontra.
examples.translation: Her opponents are being elbowed.

definitions.definition: a long, slender, snake-like fish that has smooth, slimy skin and long fins on the top and bottom rear end of its body;

examples.text: Daw sawa ang itsura kang sili.
examples.translation: Sili looks like snake.

definitions.definition: a snake-like fish that lives and is found in the sea;

examples.text: Diin kaw nagbakal sili?
examples.translation: Where did you buy eels?

examples.text: Ano nga isda diya?
examples.translation: What kind of fish is this?

definitions.definition: to make a loud sound by using one's voice;

examples.text: Nagasinggit si Gigi, "tabang!"
examples.translation: Gigi shouts. "help!"

examples.text: Nagsinggit si Tintin.
examples.translation: Tintin shouted

examples.text: Gusto mo masinggit ako?
examples.translation: Do you want me to shout?

examples.text: Gusto ko tana singgitan.
examples.translation: I want to shout at him.

examples.text: Ginasinggitan na ako.
examples.translation: He is shouting at me.

examples.text: Ginsinggitan ni Jick si Gerlyn.
examples.translation: Jick shouted at Gerlyn.

definitions.definition: a word used to ask and to know more about a given person or people

examples.translation: Who punched my child?

examples.text: Kanin-o ko itao ang kwarta?
examples.translation: To whom should I give the money?

definitions.definition: to have fun and being part of a game

examples.text: Nagasipal .tanda kang tong-its.
examples.translation: They are playing cards.

examples.text: Ginasipal nanda ang kadang.
examples.translation: They are playing kadang.

examples.text: Nagsipal tana kang basketball kahapon.
examples.translation: He played basketball yesterday.

examples.text: Ginsipal namun ang pokol.
examples.translation: We played pokol.

examples.text: Masipal tamun sa guwa.
examples.translation: We will be playing outside.

examples.translation: We are going to play the game called luksong-tinik.

examples.text: Ano ang paborito mo nga sipal?
examples.translation: What’s your favorite game?

examples.text: Bantog ra nga manugsipal sa amon.
examples.translation: He’s a popular athlete in our place

definitions.definition: having a small space that is hard to move through

examples.translation: He made his way down the narrow road.

examples.text: Sipot-sipot ang akon aragyan.
examples.translation: My road is very narrow.

definitions.definition: the thin, flat, paddle-like part of a fish that helps them swim in water

examples.text: Kaksa ang sirik kang isda.
examples.translation: Remove the fin of the fish.

definitions.definition: the singular pronoun used to refer to another person regardless of gender;

examples.text: Siya mabulos kanakun.
examples.translation: He is next to me.

definitions.definition: the number that comes after eight and comes before ten;

examples.text: Mas hapus idrowing ang numero walo kay sa siyam.
examples.translation: Number is easier to draw than number nine.

examples.text: Siyam kabilog ang estudyante sa sulod kang classroom.
examples.translation: There are nine students inside the classroom

definitions.definition: an improvised handheld kerosene lamp, usually made up of used glass container and rolled thin cloth which is lit by fire

examples.text: Dara kaw kang stringki magtukad sa bukid.
examples.translation: Bring a handheld glass tool that casts light on your way to the mountain.

definitions.definition: a wide, natural channel of water that flows across the land and delivers water to other bodies of water

examples.text: Naglukso tana sa suba.
examples.translation: She jumped into the river.

examples.text: Bugana sa dunang-manggad ang aton kasubaan.
examples.translation: Our rivers are rich in natural wealth.

definitions.definition: the first and eldest child born to a family

examples.text: Namana ang subang nga bata ni Elsy.
examples.translation: Elsy's eldest daughter got married.

examples.text: Magurang mo si Stephen? Gwapo siya.
examples.translation: Is Stephen your elder brother? He is handsome.

definitions.definition: the amount of food someone threw up after having eaten it previously

examples.text: Ang suka na garapta sa karsada.
examples.translation: His vomit scattered on the street.

examples.text: Sa grabe paimnun diyan kang beer, ridya ang surukahan sa kilid banyo.
examples.translation: To those who drink a lot of beer, the area where you can throw your vomit is beside the comfort room.

examples.text: Raku run ang ginsuka mo. Raw-ay guid batyag mo? May surukahun kaw pa?
examples.translation: You have vomitted a lot. How bad do you feel? Are you vomitting some more?

examples.text: Si Andrew nagasuka sakusina.
examples.translation: Andrew is vomitting in the kitchen.

examples.text: Ginasuka na ang anang kinaun.
examples.translation: She is vomiting the food she ate.

examples.text: Nagsuka si Andrew sa kusina.
examples.translation: Andrew vomitted in the kitchen

examples.text: Ginsukana ang bulon gnga gin painum mo kana.
examples.translation: He vomitted the medicine given him.

examples.text: I-suka ang gin-kaun mo ng adapli.
examples.translation: Throw up the food that you ate.

examples.text: Nagasururuka kang gin-inum na si Clara.
examples.translation: Clara is throwing up the drinks she drank.

examples.text: Nagsururu ka kang gin-kaon si Clara.
examples.translation: Clara vomitted the food she ate.

examples.text: Hindi pag sukahi ang lunan.
examples.translation: Do not vomit on the pillow.

examples.text: Inum kaw kang bulong para hindi kaw daw masuka-suka sa byahe.

definitions.definition: any thing that can be put inside or included into something

definitions.definition: to move from the outside of a given place to its insides

examples.translation: You, come inside.

examples.text: Nagsulod tana sa balay.
examples.translation: He went inside the house.

examples.text: Nagasulod sanda sa evacuation center.
examples.translation: They are going inside the evacuation center.

examples.text: Masulod kita tanan sa balay.
examples.translation: We will all go inside the house.

examples.text: Manog-sulod pa lang kami sa tinda.
examples.translation: We are yet to enter the market.

definitions.definition: refers to something that is inside another thing

examples.text: May sulod pa ang ref?
examples.translation: Is there anything left inside the refrigerator?

examples.text: Diin ang surudlan kang pagkaun?
examples.translation: Where is the food container?

examples.text: Manog-sulod kang tinapay obra ni tatay na.
examples.translation: His father works as a packager of bread.

definitions.definition: a glass bulb that casts light powered by electricity

examples.text: Tama ka sanag ang sulo sa balay niyo.
examples.translation: The light bulb in your house is too bright.

examples.text: Sulu-i anay ang tubang balay.
examples.translation: You turn on the light in front of our house.

definitions.definition: the part of the face that includes the lips and mouth

definitions.definition: something is burning in fire

examples.text: May hanggud nga sunog sa Miagao.
examples.translation: There is a big fire in Miagao

examples.translation: Please throw the burnt rice.

examples.text: Sunuga ang papel.
examples.translation: Burn the paper.

examples.text: Duro nga tawo ang na-ugot kang ginasunog ni Eric ang flag.
examples.translation: Many people were angry when they saw Eric burning the flag.

examples.text: Nasunog ni Charisse ang ana nga alima.

examples.text: Naga-ugot guid ako. Mangsunog ko balay ang kontra ko.

definitions.definition: to take in liquid by using one's mouth and lips in the same way one draws in air;

examples.translation: Yssa sucks the remaining ice candy.

examples.text: Ginasupsup kang lapsag ang gatas sa bote.
examples.translation: The baby is sucking the milk from the bottle.

examples.text: Nagsupsup si Ame kang duga kang bulak.
examples.translation: Ame had sucked the flower extract.

examples.text: Ginsupsup ni Ana ang awis.
examples.translation: Ana sucked the snail.

examples.text: Masupsup gid ako ka ria hay ginapatihan nga makapamayad.
examples.translation: I will suck that as it is believed that it can heal.

examples.translation: I will suck it so that it will come out.

examples.translation: Sucking using dirty straw is prohibited.

examples.text: Ang linta ang kilala nga manugsupsup kang dugo.
examples.translation: Leech is a know sucker of blood.

definitions.definition: having a height greater than normal

examples.translation: Drinking milk helps us grow tall.

examples.text: Nagtaas ikaw no?

examples.text: Nagtaas ang blood sugar ko.

definitions.definition: to send something through the air in a general or specific direction;

definitions.definition: the solid wastes made by the body and pushed out through the anus

examples.text: May bag-o nga ordinansa nga dapat ang mga nagatag-iya kang ayam ang responsable nga magbuol kang tae kang andang ayam sa karsada.
examples.translation: There's an ordinace that the dog owner should be responsible in removing their animal excrement from the roads.

examples.text: Tae run to.
examples.translation: Go, defecate now.

examples.translation: I feel like I am a worthless person in the eyes of your parents.

examples.text: Kabuhay kay Miriam. Naga-tae pa to guro.
examples.translation: Miriam is late. Maybe, she is defecating.

examples.text: Pasensya na urihi ako abot kay nag-tae pa ako antis mag-agto dya.

examples.translation: I feel like I will defecate.

definitions.definition: a word used to ask for the amount of money a given object is worth

definitions.definition: to attach and fasten something with a needle and thread

examples.translation: Emok sews his tattered clothes.

examples.text: Ginatahi ni nanay ang akun nga palda.

examples.text: Tahion ko ang bayo mo pangkasal.

examples.text: Budlay huwadun ang mga tahi sa bayo na.

examples.text: Sikat nga mananahi si Nieves.
examples.translation: Nieves is a known tailor.

definitions.definition: to take something away in secret and without permission from its owners;

examples.text: Gintakaw na akun kwarta.

examples.text: Nagapanakaw ang bata kang kaun.

examples.text: Nagpanakaw ako kang lapis.

examples.text: Raku ang binalik nga tinakawan.

definitions.definition: action, event happening at least one time regularly over a given period of time

examples.text: Talagsa lang ko maghibi.

examples.text: Tumalagsahun ang sahi kang pispis nga nakita ko.
examples.translation: I saw a rare species of bird.

definitions.definition: one of the two fleshy extensions on both sides of the head and use for hearing sounds

examples.text: Tama ka lapad ang talinga ka ayam.
examples.translation: The dog has very wide ears.

definitions.definition: a large area covered by trees and where other plants grow

examples.text: Nag-agto kami sa talon.
examples.translation: We went to the forest.

definitions.definition: the body tissue that lies below the skin and surrounds certain organs to protect them

examples.text: Tambuk si Leo.
examples.translation: Leo is Fat.

examples.text: Nagatinambuk lang si Leo kada adlaw.
examples.translation: Leo is getting fatter everyday.

examples.text: Makatarambuk ang pagkaon it mga matam-is.
examples.translation: Sweets will make you fat.

definitions.definition: having the pleasant taste or smell of sugar

examples.text: Tam-is ang dulce.
examples.translation: The candy is sweet.

examples.text: Tam-is-tam-is ang bandi.
examples.translation: The bandi is very sweet.

definitions.definition: a garden or plantation field

examples.text: Pirte ka lapad ang taramnan kang bombay sa Brgy. Uno ba.
examples.translation: The plantation site of onions at Brgy. Uno is very wide.

examples.text: Tamnan ta diya nga lupa.

examples.text: Gin-tamnan ko kang tarong ang bakante nga lupa.
examples.translation: I planted the vacant lot with eggplant.

definitions.definition: the singular pronoun used to refer to another person regardless of gender;

examples.text: Tana lang kuno maraha kang irigmaun.
examples.translation: He will cook food for lunch.

definitions.definition: including everything or everyone in a given set;

examples.text: Tanan kami nag-agto sa piyesta.
examples.translation: All of us went to the fiesta.

definitions.definition: a small, flat, dark-brown insect that has six legs and two pairs of wings, and can move fast and even fly;

examples.text: May langaw ang kan-un.

examples.translation: The food will be infested by cockroach if you keep them inside the paper box.

definitions.definition: a living thing that commonly grows on the ground, usually with leaves or flowers, and needs sun, water and air to live

examples.text: Ano dya nga tanum?
examples.translation: What plant is this?

examples.text: Diin run manogtanum mo?
examples.translation: Where is your planter?

examples.text: Tulad nga Nobyembre ang tag-taranum kang bomboy.
examples.translation: This month of November is the planting season of onions.

examples.translation: What plant is this?

examples.text: Gintanum ko ang liso kang lemon sagwa balay.

examples.translation: Which part of the apple is being planted for it to grow?

examples.text: Mananum kuno kita ka mangga sa rum-an sagwa balay
examples.translation: We will plant mangoes tomorrow ourside our house.

examples.translation: My mother is planting eggplant outside our house.

examples.text: May taranum kaw diyan nga liso?
